Overload.descr:
WP: Convert a value to non-negative integer.
$maybeint Data you wish to have converted to a non-negative integer.
Returns: (int) A non-negative integer.

WP: Attempts activation of plugin in a "sandbox" and redirects on success.
$plugin Path to the plugin file relative to the plugins directory.
$redirect URL to redirect to.
$network_wide Whether to enable the plugin for all sites in the network or just the current site. Multisite only.
$silent Whether to prevent calling activation hooks.
Returns: (null|WP_Error) Null on success, WP_Error on invalid file.

WP: Activate multiple plugins.
$plugins Single plugin or list of plugins to activate.
$redirect Redirect to page after successful activation.
$network_wide Whether to enable the plugin for all sites in the network.
$silent Prevent calling activation hooks.
Returns: (bool|WP_Error) True when finished or WP_Error if there were errors during a plugin activation.

WP: Deprecated functionality for activating a network-only plugin.
Returns: (void)

WP: Adds slashes to escape strings.
$gpc The string returned from HTTP request data.
Returns: (string) Returns a string escaped with slashes.

WP: Adds slashes only if the provided value is a string.
$value
Returns: (mixed)

WP: Adds a callback function to an action hook.
$hook_name The name of the action to add the callback to.
$callback The callback to be run when the action is called.
$priority Used to specify the order in which the functions associated with a particular action are executed. Lower numbers correspond with earlier execution, and functions with the same priority are executed in the order in which they were added to the action.
$accepted_args The number of arguments the function accepts.
Returns: (true) Always returns true.

WP: Adds an array of options to the list of allowed options.
$new_options
$options
Returns: (array)

WP: Add a new option for a given blog ID.
$id A blog ID. Can be null to refer to the current blog.
$option Name of option to add. Expected to not be SQL-escaped.
$value Option value, can be anything. Expected to not be SQL-escaped.
Returns: (bool) True if the option was added, false otherwise.

WP: Adds an index to a specified table.
$table Database table name.
$index Database table index column.
Returns: (true) True, when done with execution.

WP: Add submenu page to the Comments main menu.
$page_title The text to be displayed in the title tags of the page when the menu is selected.
$menu_title The text to be used for the menu.
$capability The capability required for this menu to be displayed to the user.
$menu_slug The slug name to refer to this menu by (should be unique for this menu).
$function The function to be called to output the content for this page.
$position The position in the menu order this item should appear.
Returns: (string|false) The resulting page's hook_suffix, or false if the user does not have the capability required.

WP: Add meta data field to a comment.
$comment_id Comment ID.
$meta_key Metadata name.
$meta_value Metadata value. Must be serializable if non-scalar.
$unique Whether the same key should not be added.
Returns: (int|false) Meta ID on success, false on failure.

WP: Add contextual help text for a page.
$screen The handle for the screen to add help to. This is usually the hook name returned by the add_*_page() functions.
$help The content of an 'Overview' help tab.
Returns: (void)

WP: Add callbacks for background image display.
$wp_head_callback Call on the 'wp_head' action.
$admin_head_callback Call on custom background administration screen.
$admin_preview_callback Output a custom background image div on the custom background administration screen. Optional.
Returns: (void)

WP: Add callbacks for image header display.
$wp_head_callback Call on the 'wp_head' action.
$admin_head_callback Call on custom header administration screen.
$admin_preview_callback Output a custom header image div on the custom header administration screen. Optional.
Returns: (void)

WP: Add submenu page to the Dashboard main menu.
$page_title The text to be displayed in the title tags of the page when the menu is selected.
$menu_title The text to be used for the menu.
$capability The capability required for this menu to be displayed to the user.
$menu_slug The slug name to refer to this menu by (should be unique for this menu).
$function The function to be called to output the content for this page.
$position The position in the menu order this item should appear.
Returns: (string|false) The resulting page's hook_suffix, or false if the user does not have the capability required.

WP: Adds callback for custom TinyMCE editor stylesheets.
$stylesheet Stylesheet name or array thereof, relative to theme root. Defaults to 'editor-style.css'
Returns: (void)

WP: Add a user to a blog based on details from maybe_add_existing_user_to_blog().
$details User details. Must at least contain values for the keys listed below. 'user_id'(int) The ID of the user being added to the current blog. 'role'(string) The role to be assigned to the user.
Returns: (true|WP_Error|void) True on success or a WP_Error object if the user doesn't exist or could not be added. Void if $details array was not provided.

WP: Add a new feed type like /atom1/.
$feedname Feed name.
$function Callback to run on feed display.
Returns: (string) Feed action name.

WP: Adds a callback function to a filter hook.
$hook_name The name of the filter to add the callback to.
$callback The callback to be run when the filter is applied.
$priority Used to specify the order in which the functions associated with a particular filter are executed. Lower numbers correspond with earlier execution, and functions with the same priority are executed in the order in which they were added to the filter.
$accepted_args The number of arguments the function accepts.
Returns: (true) Always returns true.

WP: Register a new image size.
$name Image size identifier.
$width Image width in pixels. Default 0.
$height Image height in pixels. Default 0.
$crop Image cropping behavior. If false, the image will be scaled (default), If true, image will be cropped to the specified dimensions using center positions. If an array, the image will be cropped using the array to specify the crop location. Array values must be in the format: array( x_crop_position, y_crop_position ) where: x_crop_position accepts: 'left', 'center', or 'right'. y_crop_position accepts: 'top', 'center', or 'bottom'.
Returns: (void)

WP: Add a link to using values provided in $_POST.
Returns: (int|WP_Error) Value 0 or WP_Error on failure. The link ID on success.

WP: Add submenu page to the Links main menu.
$page_title The text to be displayed in the title tags of the page when the menu is selected.
$menu_title The text to be used for the menu.
$capability The capability required for this menu to be displayed to the user.
$menu_slug The slug name to refer to this menu by (should be unique for this menu).
$function The function to be called to output the content for this page.
$position The position in the menu order this item should appear.
Returns: (string|false) The resulting page's hook_suffix, or false if the user does not have the capability required.

WP: Walks the array while sanitizing the contents.
$array Array to walk while sanitizing contents.
Returns: (array) Sanitized $array.

WP: Add submenu page to the Tools main menu.
$page_title The text to be displayed in the title tags of the page when the menu is selected.
$menu_title The text to be used for the menu.
$capability The capability required for this menu to be displayed to the user.
$menu_slug The slug name to refer to this menu by (should be unique for this menu).
$function The function to be called to output the content for this page.
$position The position in the menu order this item should appear.
Returns: (string|false) The resulting page's hook_suffix, or false if the user does not have the capability required.

WP: Add submenu page to the Media main menu.
$page_title The text to be displayed in the title tags of the page when the menu is selected.
$menu_title The text to be used for the menu.
$capability The capability required for this menu to be displayed to the user.
$menu_slug The slug name to refer to this menu by (should be unique for this menu).
$function The function to be called to output the content for this page.
$position The position in the menu order this item should appear.
Returns: (string|false) The resulting page's hook_suffix, or false if the user does not have the capability required.

WP: Add a top-level menu page.
$page_title The text to be displayed in the title tags of the page when the menu is selected.
$menu_title The text to be used for the menu.
$capability The capability required for this menu to be displayed to the user.
$menu_slug The slug name to refer to this menu by. Should be unique for this menu page and only include lowercase alphanumeric, dashes, and underscores characters to be compatible with sanitize_key().
$function The function to be called to output the content for this page.
$icon_url The URL to the icon to be used for this menu. Pass a base64-encoded SVG using a data URI, which will be colored to match the color scheme. This should begin with 'data:image/svg+xml;base64,'. Pass the name of a Dashicons helper class to use a font icon, e.g. 'dashicons-chart-pie'. Pass 'none' to leave div.wp-menu-image empty so an icon can be added via CSS.
$position The position in the menu order this item should appear.
Returns: (string) The resulting page's hook_suffix.

WP: Add post meta data defined in $_POST superglobal for post with given ID.
$post_ID
Returns: (int|bool)

WP: Adds metadata for the specified object.
$meta_type Type of object metadata is for. Accepts 'post', 'comment', 'term', 'user', or any other object type with an associated meta table.
$object_id ID of the object metadata is for.
$meta_key Metadata key.
$meta_value Metadata value. Must be serializable if non-scalar.
$unique Whether the specified metadata key should be unique for the object. If true, and the object already has a value for the specified metadata key, no change will be made.
Returns: (int|false) The meta ID on success, false on failure.

WP: Adds a meta box to one or more screens.
$id Meta box ID (used in the 'id' attribute for the meta box).
$title Title of the meta box.
$callback Function that fills the box with the desired content. The function should echo its output.
$screen The screen or screens on which to show the box (such as a post type, 'link', or 'comment'). Accepts a single screen ID, WP_Screen object, or array of screen IDs. Default is the current screen. If you have used add_menu_page() or add_submenu_page() to create a new screen (and hence screen_id), make sure your menu slug conforms to the limits of sanitize_key() otherwise the 'screen' menu may not correctly render on your page.
$context The context within the screen where the box should display. Available contexts vary from screen to screen. Post edit screen contexts include 'normal', 'side', and 'advanced'. Comments screen contexts include 'normal' and 'side'. Menus meta boxes (accordion sections) all use the 'side' context. Global
$priority The priority within the context where the box should show. Accepts 'high', 'core', 'default', or 'low'.
$callback_args Data that should be set as the $args property of the box array (which is the second parameter passed to your callback).
Returns: (void)

WP: Adds a new network option.
$network_id ID of the network. Can be null to default to the current network ID.
$option Name of the option to add. Expected to not be SQL-escaped.
$value Option value, can be anything. Expected to not be SQL-escaped.
Returns: (bool) True if the option was added, false otherwise.

WP: Adds a newly created user to the appropriate blog
$user_id User ID.
$password User password. Ignored.
$meta Signup meta data.
Returns: (void)

WP: Add a top-level menu page in the ‘objects’ section.
$page_title The text to be displayed in the title tags of the page when the menu is selected.
$menu_title The text to be used for the menu.
$capability The capability required for this menu to be displayed to the user.
$menu_slug The slug name to refer to this menu by (should be unique for this menu).
$function The function to be called to output the content for this page.
$icon_url The url to the icon to be used for this menu.
Returns: (string) The resulting page's hook_suffix.

WP: Adds a new option.
$option Name of the option to add. Expected to not be SQL-escaped.
$value Option value. Must be serializable if non-scalar. Expected to not be SQL-escaped.
$deprecated Description. Not used anymore.
$autoload Whether to load the option when WordPress starts up. Default is enabled. Accepts 'no' to disable for legacy reasons.
Returns: (bool) True if the option was added, false otherwise.

WP: Add submenu page to the Settings main menu.
$page_title The text to be displayed in the title tags of the page when the menu is selected.
$menu_title The text to be used for the menu.
$capability The capability required for this menu to be displayed to the user.
$menu_slug The slug name to refer to this menu by (should be unique for this menu).
$function The function to be called to output the content for this page.
$position The position in the menu order this item should appear.
Returns: (string|false) The resulting page's hook_suffix, or false if the user does not have the capability required.

WP: Register a setting and its sanitization callback
$option_group A settings group name. Should correspond to an allowed option key name. Default allowed option key names include 'general', 'discussion', 'media', 'reading', 'writing', 'misc', 'options', and 'privacy'.
$option_name The name of an option to sanitize and save.
$sanitize_callback A callback function that sanitizes the option's value.
Returns: (void)

WP: Adds an array of options to the list of allowed options.
$new_options
$options
Returns: (array)

WP: Add submenu page to the Pages main menu.
$page_title The text to be displayed in the title tags of the page when the menu is selected.
$menu_title The text to be used for the menu.
$capability The capability required for this menu to be displayed to the user.
$menu_slug The slug name to refer to this menu by (should be unique for this menu).
$function The function to be called to output the content for this page.
$position The position in the menu order this item should appear.
Returns: (string|false) The resulting page's hook_suffix, or false if the user does not have the capability required.

WP: Add permalink structure.
$name Name for permalink structure.
$struct Permalink structure.
$args Arguments for building the rules from the permalink structure, see WP_Rewrite::add_permastruct() for full details.
Returns: (void)

WP: Add a URL to those already pinged.
$post_id Post object or ID.
$uri Ping URI or array of URIs.
Returns: (int|false) How many rows were updated.

WP: Add submenu page to the Plugins main menu.
$page_title The text to be displayed in the title tags of the page when the menu is selected.
$menu_title The text to be used for the menu.
$capability The capability required for this menu to be displayed to the user.
$menu_slug The slug name to refer to this menu by (should be unique for this menu).
$function The function to be called to output the content for this page.
$position The position in the menu order this item should appear.
Returns: (string|false) The resulting page's hook_suffix, or false if the user does not have the capability required.

WP: Add submenu page to the Posts main menu.
$page_title The text to be displayed in the title tags of the page when the menu is selected.
$menu_title The text to be used for the menu.
$capability The capability required for this menu to be displayed to the user.
$menu_slug The slug name to refer to this menu by (should be unique for this menu).
$function The function to be called to output the content for this page.
$position The position in the menu order this item should appear.
Returns: (string|false) The resulting page's hook_suffix, or false if the user does not have the capability required.

WP: Adds a meta field to the given post.
$post_id Post ID.
$meta_key Metadata name.
$meta_value Metadata value. Must be serializable if non-scalar.
$unique Whether the same key should not be added.
Returns: (int|false) Meta ID on success, false on failure.

WP: Registers support of certain features for a post type.
$post_type The post type for which to add the feature.
$feature The feature being added, accepts an array of feature strings or a single string.
$args extra arguments to pass along with certain features.
Returns: (void)

WP: Retrieves a modified URL query string.
$key Either a query variable key, or an associative array of query variables.
$value Either a query variable value, or a URL to act upon.
$url A URL to act upon.
Returns: (string) New URL query string (unescaped).

WP: Add an endpoint, like /trackback/.
$name Name of the endpoint.
$places Endpoint mask describing the places the endpoint should be added. Accepts a mask of: EP_ALL EP_NONE EP_ALL_ARCHIVES EP_ATTACHMENT EP_AUTHORS EP_CATEGORIES EP_COMMENTS EP_DATE EP_DAY EP_MONTH EP_PAGES EP_PERMALINK EP_ROOT EP_SEARCH EP_TAGS EP_YEAR
$query_var Name of the corresponding query variable. Pass false to skip registering a query_var for this endpoint. Defaults to the value of $name.
Returns: (void)

WP: Adds a rewrite rule that transforms a URL structure to a set of query vars.
$regex Regular expression to match request against.
$query The corresponding query vars for this rewrite rule.
$after Priority of the new rule. Accepts 'top' or 'bottom'.
Returns: (void)

WP: Add a new rewrite tag (like %postname%).
$tag Name of the new rewrite tag.
$regex Regular expression to substitute the tag for in rewrite rules.
$query String to append to the rewritten query. Must end in '='.
Returns: (void)

WP: Add role, if it does not exist.
$role Role name.
$display_name Display name for role.
$capabilities List of capabilities keyed by the capability name, e.g. array( 'edit_posts' => true, 'delete_posts' => false ).
Returns: (WP_Role|null) WP_Role object if role is added, null if already exists.

WP: Register and configure an admin screen option
$option An option name.
$args Option-dependent arguments.
Returns: (void)

WP: Register a settings error to be displayed to the user. $setting Slug title of the setting to which this error applies. $code Slug-name to identify the error. Used as part of 'id' attribute in HTML output. $message The formatted message text to display to the user (will be shown inside styled
and

tags). $type Message type, controls HTML class. Possible values include 'error', 'success', 'warning', 'info'. Returns: (void)

WP: Add a new field to a section of a settings page.
$id Slug-name to identify the field. Used in the 'id' attribute of tags.
$title Formatted title of the field. Shown as the label for the field during output.
$callback Function that fills the field with the desired form inputs. The function should echo its output.
$page The slug-name of the settings page on which to show the section (general, reading, writing,...).
$section The slug-name of the section of the settings page in which to show the box.
$args Extra arguments used when outputting the field. 'label_for'(string) When supplied, the setting title will be wrapped in a <label> element, its for attribute populated with this value. 'class'(string) CSS Class to be added to the <tr> element when the field is output.
Returns: (void)

WP: Add a new section to a settings page.
$id Slug-name to identify the section. Used in the 'id' attribute of tags.
$title Formatted title of the section. Shown as the heading for the section.
$callback Function that echos out any content at the top of the section (between heading and fields).
$page The slug-name of the settings page on which to show the section. Built-in pages include 'general', 'reading', 'writing', 'discussion', 'media', etc. Create your own using add_options_page();
Returns: (void)

WP: Adds a new shortcode.
$tag Shortcode tag to be searched in post content.
$callback The callback function to run when the shortcode is found. Every shortcode callback is passed three parameters by default, including an array of attributes ($atts), the shortcode content or null if not set ($content), and finally the shortcode tag itself ($shortcode_tag), in that order.
Returns: (void)

WP: Adds metadata to a site.
$site_id Site ID.
$meta_key Metadata name.
$meta_value Metadata value. Must be serializable if non-scalar.
$unique Whether the same key should not be added.
Returns: (int|false) Meta ID on success, false on failure.

WP: Adds a new option for the current network.
$option Name of the option to add. Expected to not be SQL-escaped.
$value Option value, can be anything. Expected to not be SQL-escaped.
Returns: (bool) True if the option was added, false otherwise.

WP: Add a submenu page.
$parent_slug The slug name for the parent menu (or the file name of a standard WordPress admin page).
$page_title The text to be displayed in the title tags of the page when the menu is selected.
$menu_title The text to be used for the menu.
$capability The capability required for this menu to be displayed to the user.
$menu_slug The slug name to refer to this menu by. Should be unique for this menu and only include lowercase alphanumeric, dashes, and underscores characters to be compatible with sanitize_key().
$function The function to be called to output the content for this page.
$position The position in the menu order this item should appear.
Returns: (string|false) The resulting page's hook_suffix, or false if the user does not have the capability required.

WP: Adds metadata to a term.
$term_id Term ID.
$meta_key Metadata name.
$meta_value Metadata value. Must be serializable if non-scalar.
$unique Whether the same key should not be added.
Returns: (int|false|WP_Error) Meta ID on success, false on failure. WP_Error when term_id is ambiguous between taxonomies.

WP: Add submenu page to the Appearance main menu.
$page_title The text to be displayed in the title tags of the page when the menu is selected.
$menu_title The text to be used for the menu.
$capability The capability required for this menu to be displayed to the user.
$menu_slug The slug name to refer to this menu by (should be unique for this menu).
$function The function to be called to output the content for this page.
$position The position in the menu order this item should appear.
Returns: (string|false) The resulting page's hook_suffix, or false if the user does not have the capability required.

WP: Registers theme support for a given feature.
$feature The feature being added. Likely core values include: 'admin-bar' 'align-wide' 'automatic-feed-links' 'core-block-patterns' 'custom-background' 'custom-header' 'custom-line-height' 'custom-logo' 'customize-selective-refresh-widgets' 'custom-spacing' 'custom-units' 'dark-editor-style' 'disable-custom-colors' 'disable-custom-font-sizes' 'editor-color-palette' 'editor-gradient-presets' 'editor-font-sizes' 'editor-styles' 'featured-content' 'html5' 'menus' 'post-formats' 'post-thumbnails' 'responsive-embeds' 'starter-content' 'title-tag' 'wp-block-styles' 'widgets' 'widgets-block-editor'
$args extra arguments to pass along with certain features.
Returns: (void|false) Void on success, false on failure.

WP: Enqueues the default ThickBox js and css.
Returns: (void)

WP: Creates a new user from the "Users" form using $_POST information.
Returns: (int|WP_Error) WP_Error or User ID.

WP: Add submenu page to the Users/Profile main menu.
$page_title The text to be displayed in the title tags of the page when the menu is selected.
$menu_title The text to be used for the menu.
$capability The capability required for this menu to be displayed to the user.
$menu_slug The slug name to refer to this menu by (should be unique for this menu).
$function The function to be called to output the content for this page.
$position The position in the menu order this item should appear.
Returns: (string|false) The resulting page's hook_suffix, or false if the user does not have the capability required.

WP: Adds meta data to a user.
$user_id User ID.
$meta_key Metadata name.
$meta_value Metadata value. Must be serializable if non-scalar.
$unique Whether the same key should not be added.
Returns: (int|false) Meta ID on success, false on failure.

WP: Adds a user to a blog, along with specifying the user’s role.
$blog_id ID of the blog the user is being added to.
$user_id ID of the user being added.
$role The role you want the user to have.
Returns: (true|WP_Error) True on success or a WP_Error object if the user doesn't exist or could not be added.

WP: Add a top-level menu page in the ‘utility’ section.
$page_title The text to be displayed in the title tags of the page when the menu is selected.
$menu_title The text to be used for the menu.
$capability The capability required for this menu to be displayed to the user.
$menu_slug The slug name to refer to this menu by (should be unique for this menu).
$function The function to be called to output the content for this page.
$icon_url The url to the icon to be used for this menu.
Returns: (string) The resulting page's hook_suffix.

WP: Displays next or previous image link that has the same post parent.
$prev Whether to display the next (false) or previous (true) link.
$size Image size. Accepts any registered image size name, or an array of width and height values in pixels (in that order).
$text Link text.
Returns: (void)

WP: Displays the relational links for the posts adjacent to the current post.
$title Link title format.
$in_same_term Whether link should be in a same taxonomy term.
$excluded_terms Array or comma-separated list of excluded term IDs.
$taxonomy Taxonomy, if $in_same_term is true.
Returns: (void)

WP: Displays relational links for the posts adjacent to the current post for single post pages.
Returns: (void)

WP: Displays the adjacent post link.
$format Link anchor format.
$link Link permalink format.
$in_same_term Whether link should be in a same taxonomy term.
$excluded_terms Array or comma-separated list of excluded category IDs.
$previous Whether to display link to previous or next post.
$taxonomy Taxonomy, if $in_same_term is true.
Returns: (void)

WP: Display the default admin color scheme picker (Used in user-edit.php)
$user_id User ID.
Returns: (void)

WP: Retrieves the URL to the admin area for the current site.
$path Path relative to the admin URL. Default 'admin'.
$scheme The scheme to use. Default is 'admin', which obeys force_ssl_admin() and is_ssl(). 'http' or 'https' can be passed to force those schemes.
Returns: (string) Admin URL link with optional path appended.

WP: Mark allowed redirect hosts safe for HTTP requests as well.
$is_external
$host
Returns: (bool)

WP: Display all of the allowed tags in HTML format with attributes.
Returns: (string) HTML allowed tags entity encoded.

WP: Allow subdirectory installation.
Returns: (bool) Whether subdirectory installation is allowed

WP: Allow subdomain installation
Returns: (bool) Whether subdomain installation is allowed

WP: Converts email addresses characters to HTML entities to block spam bots.
$email_address Email address.
$hex_encoding Set to 1 to enable hex encoding.
Returns: (string) Converted email address.

WP: Does the specified module exist in the Apache config?
$mod The module, e.g. mod_rewrite.
$default The default return value if the module is not found.
Returns: (bool) Whether the specified module is loaded.

WP: Calls the callback functions that have been added to a filter hook.
$hook_name The name of the filter hook.
$value The value to filter.
$args Additional parameters to pass to the callback functions.
Returns: (mixed) The filtered value after all hooked functions are applied to it.

WP: Fires functions attached to a deprecated filter hook.
$hook_name The name of the filter hook.
$args Array of additional function arguments to be passed to apply_filters().
$version The version of WordPress that deprecated the hook.
$replacement The hook that should have been used.
$message A message regarding the change.
Returns: (void)

WP: Calls the callback functions that have been added to a filter hook, specifying arguments in an array.
$hook_name The name of the filter hook.
$args The arguments supplied to the functions hooked to $hook_name.
Returns: (mixed) The filtered value after all hooked functions are applied to it.

WP: Search content for shortcodes and filter shortcodes through their hooks.
$content Content to search for shortcodes.
$ignore_html When true, shortcodes inside HTML elements will be skipped.
Returns: (string) Content with shortcodes filtered out.

WP: Display the atom enclosure for the current post.
Returns: (void)

WP: Displays Site Icon in atom feeds.
Returns: (void)

WP: Display fields for ID3 data
$post A post object.
Returns: (void)

WP: Displays non-editable attachment metadata in the publish meta box.
Returns: (void)

WP: Display attachment submit form fields.
$post
Returns: (void)

WP: Tries to convert an attachment URL into a post ID.
$url The URL to resolve.
Returns: (int) The found post ID, or 0 on failure.

WP: Escaping for HTML attributes.
$text
Returns: (string)

WP: Returns whether the author of the supplied post has the specified capability.
$post Post ID or post object.
$capability Capability name.
$args further parameters, typically starting with an object ID.
Returns: (bool) Whether the post author has the given capability.

WP: Checks if a user is logged in, if not it redirects them to the login page.
Returns: (void)

WP: Enable/disable automatic general feed link outputting.
$add Add or remove links.
Returns: (void)

WP: Outputs a complete commenting form for use within a template. $args Default arguments and form fields to override. 'fields'(array) Default comment fields, filterable by default via the 'comment_form_default_fields' hook. 'author'(string) Comment author field HTML. 'email'(string) Comment author email field HTML. 'url'(string) Comment author URL field HTML. 'cookies'(string) Comment cookie opt-in field HTML. 'comment_field'(string) The comment textarea field HTML. 'must_log_in'(string) HTML element for a 'must be logged in to comment' message. 'logged_in_as'(string) HTML element for a 'logged in as [user]' message. 'comment_notes_before'(string) HTML element for a message displayed before the comment fields if the user is not logged in. Default 'Your email address will not be published.'. 'comment_notes_after'(string) HTML element for a message displayed after the textarea field. 'action'(string) The comment form element action attribute. Default '/wp-comments-post.php'. 'id_form'(string) The comment form element id attribute. Default 'commentform'. 'id_submit'(string) The comment submit element id attribute. Default 'submit'. 'class_container'(string) The comment form container class attribute. Default 'comment-respond'. 'class_form'(string) The comment form element class attribute. Default 'comment-form'. 'class_submit'(string) The comment submit element class attribute. Default 'submit'. 'name_submit'(string) The comment submit element name attribute. Default 'submit'. 'title_reply'(string) The translatable 'reply' button label. Default 'Leave a Reply'. 'title_reply_to'(string) The translatable 'reply-to' button label. Default 'Leave a Reply to %s', where %s is the author of the comment being replied to. 'title_reply_before'(string) HTML displayed before the comment form title. Default:

. 'title_reply_after'(string) HTML displayed after the comment form title. Default:

. 'cancel_reply_before'(string) HTML displayed before the cancel reply link. 'cancel_reply_after'(string) HTML displayed after the cancel reply link. 'cancel_reply_link'(string) The translatable 'cancel reply' button label. Default 'Cancel reply'. 'label_submit'(string) The translatable 'submit' button label. Default 'Post a comment'. 'submit_button'(string) HTML format for the Submit button. Default: . 'submit_field'(string) HTML format for the markup surrounding the Submit button and comment hidden fields. Default:

%1$s %2$s

, where %1$s is the submit button markup and %2$s is the comment hidden fields. 'format'(string) The comment form format. Default 'xhtml'. Accepts 'xhtml', 'html5'. $post_id Post ID or WP_Post object to generate the form for. Default current post. Returns: (void)

Returns: (void)

WP: Deletes metadata for the specified object.

Pass null, false, or an empty string to skip this check. (For backward compatibility, it is not possible to pass an empty string to delete those entries with an empty string for a value.)
$delete_all If true, delete matching metadata entries for all objects, ignoring the specified object_id. Otherwise, only delete matching metadata entries for the specified object_id.
Returns: (bool) True on successful delete, false on failure.

Returns: (bool) True if the option was deleted, false otherwise.

WP: Deletes a site transient.
$transient Transient name. Expected to not be SQL-escaped.
Returns: (bool) True if the transient was deleted, false otherwise.

WP: Removes metadata matching criteria from a term.
$term_id Term ID.
$meta_key Metadata name.
$meta_value Metadata value. If provided, rows will only be removed that match the value. Must be serializable if non-scalar.
Returns: (bool) True on success, false on failure.

WP: Remove a theme
$stylesheet Stylesheet of the theme to delete.
$redirect Redirect to page when complete.
Returns: (bool|null|WP_Error) True on success, false if $stylesheet is empty, WP_Error on failure. Null if filesystem credentials are required to proceed.

WP: Deletes a transient.
$transient Transient name. Expected to not be SQL-escaped.
Returns: (bool) True if the transient was deleted, false otherwise.

WP: Remove user meta data.
$user_id User ID.
$meta_key Metadata key.
$meta_value Metadata value.
Returns: (bool) True deletion completed and false if user_id is not a number.

WP: Remove metadata matching criteria from a user.
$user_id User ID
$meta_key Metadata name.
$meta_value Metadata value. If provided, rows will only be removed that match the value. Must be serializable if non-scalar.
Returns: (bool) True on success, false on failure.

WP: Delete user option with global blog capability.
$user_id User ID
$option_name User option name.
$global Whether option name is global or blog specific. Default false (blog specific).
Returns: (bool) True on success, false on failure.

WP: Deletes user interface settings.
$names The name or array of names of the setting to be deleted.
Returns: (bool|null) True if deleted successfully, false otherwise. Null if the current user is not a member of the site.

Returns: (void)

WP: Generates the WXR export file for download.
$args Arguments for generating the WXR export file for download. 'content'(string) Type of content to export. If set, only the post content of this post type will be exported. Accepts 'all', 'post', 'page', 'attachment', or a defined custom post. If an invalid custom post type is supplied, every post type for which can_export is enabled will be exported instead. If a valid custom post type is supplied but can_export is disabled, then 'posts' will be exported instead. When 'all' is supplied, only post types with can_export enabled will be exported. Default 'all'. 'author'(string) Author to export content for. Only used when $content is 'post', 'page', or 'attachment'. Accepts false (all) or a specific author ID. Default false (all). 'category'(string) Category (slug) to export content for. Used only when $content is 'post'. If set, only post content assigned to $category will be exported. Accepts false or a specific category slug. Default is false (all categories). 'start_date'(string) Start date to export content from. Expected date format is 'Y-m-d'. Used only when $content is 'post', 'page' or 'attachment'. Default false (since the beginning of time). 'end_date'(string) End date to export content to. Expected date format is 'Y-m-d'. Used only when $content is 'post', 'page' or 'attachment'. Default false (latest publish date). 'status'(string) Post status to export posts for. Used only when $content is 'post' or 'page'. Accepts false (all statuses except 'auto-draft'), or a specific status, i.e. 'publish', 'pending', 'draft', 'auto-draft', 'future', 'private', 'inherit', or 'trash'. Default false (all statuses except 'auto-draft').
Returns: (void)

WP: Builds the Gallery shortcode output.
$attr Attributes of the gallery shortcode. 'order'(string) Order of the images in the gallery. Default 'ASC'. Accepts 'ASC', 'DESC'. 'orderby'(string) The field to use when ordering the images. Default 'menu_order ID'. Accepts any valid SQL ORDERBY statement. 'id'(int) Post ID. 'itemtag'(string) HTML tag to use for each image in the gallery. Default 'dl', or 'figure' when the theme registers HTML5 gallery support. 'icontag'(string) HTML tag to use for each image's icon. Default 'dt', or 'div' when the theme registers HTML5 gallery support. 'captiontag'(string) HTML tag to use for each image's caption. Default 'dd', or 'figcaption' when the theme registers HTML5 gallery support. 'columns'(int) Number of columns of images to display. Default 3. 'size'(string|int[]) Size of the images to display. Accepts any registered image size name, or an array of width and height values in pixels (in that order). Default 'thumbnail'. 'ids'(string) A comma-separated list of IDs of attachments to display. Default empty. 'include'(string) A comma-separated list of IDs of attachments to include. Default empty. 'exclude'(string) A comma-separated list of IDs of attachments to exclude. Default empty. 'link'(string) What to link each image to. Default empty (links to the attachment page). Accepts 'file', 'none'.
Returns: (string) HTML content to display gallery.

WP: Get an array of ancestor IDs for a given object.
$object_id The ID of the object. Default 0.
$object_type The type of object for which we'll be retrieving ancestors. Accepts a post type or a taxonomy name.
$resource_type Type of resource $object_type is. Accepts 'post_type' or 'taxonomy'.
Returns: (int[]) An array of IDs of ancestors from lowest to highest in the hierarchy.

WP: Retrieve the approved comments for post $post_id.
$post_id The ID of the post.
$args See WP_Comment_Query::__construct() for information on accepted arguments.
Returns: (int|array) The approved comments, or number of comments if $count argument is true.

WP: Retrieves a list of archives.
$type
$limit
$format
$before
$after
$show_post_count
Returns: (string|null)

WP: Retrieve archive link content based on predefined or custom code.
$url URL to archive.
$text Archive text description.
$format Can be 'link', 'option', 'html', or custom.
$before Content to prepend to the description.
$after Content to append to the description.
$selected Set to true if the current page is the selected archive page.
Returns: (string) HTML link content for archive.

WP: Retrieve path of archive template in current or parent template.
Returns: (string) Full path to archive template file.

WP: Retrieve attached file path based on attachment ID.
$attachment_id Attachment ID.
$unfiltered Whether to apply filters.
Returns: (string|false) The file path to where the attached file should be, false otherwise.

WP: Retrieves media attached to the passed post.
$type Mime type.
$post Post ID or WP_Post object. Default is global $post.
Returns: (WP_Post[]) Array of media attached to the given post.

WP: Retrieves the attachment fields to edit form fields.
$post
$errors
Returns: (array)

WP: Retrieve HTML content of icon attachment image element.
$id Post ID.
$fullsize Whether to have full size image.
$max_dims Dimensions of image.
Returns: (string|false) HTML content.

WP: Retrieve icon URL and Path.
$id Post ID.
$fullsize Whether to have full image.
Returns: (array) Icon URL and full path to file, respectively.

WP: Retrieve HTML content of image element.
$id Post ID.
$fullsize Whether to have full size image.
$max_dims Dimensions of image.
Returns: (string|false)

WP: Retrieves the permalink for an attachment.
$post Post ID or object. Default uses the global $post.
$leavename Whether to keep the page name.
Returns: (string) The attachment permalink.

WP: Retrieves taxonomies attached to given the attachment.
$attachment Attachment ID, data array, or data object.
$output Output type. 'names' to return an array of taxonomy names, or 'objects' to return an array of taxonomy objects. Default is 'names'.
Returns: (string[]|WP_Taxonomy[]) List of taxonomies or taxonomy names. Empty array on failure.

WP: Retrieve path of attachment template in current or parent template.
Returns: (string) Full path to attachment template file.

WP: Retrieves the feed link for a given author.
$author_id Author ID.
$feed Feed type. Possible values include 'rss2', 'atom'. Default is the value of get_default_feed().
Returns: (string) Link to the feed for the author specified by $author_id.

WP: Returns or Prints link to the author’s posts.

$author_id
$author_nicename
Returns: (string|null)

WP: Retrieve the specified author’s preferred display name.
$auth_id The ID of the author.
Returns: (string) The author's display name.

WP: Retrieve the URL to the author page for the user with the ID provided.
$author_id Author ID.
$author_nicename The author's nicename (slug).
Returns: (string) The URL to the author's page.

WP: Print/Return link to author RSS feed.
$echo
$author_id
Returns: (string)

WP: Retrieve path of author template in current or parent template.
Returns: (string) Full path to author template file.

WP: Get all user IDs.
Returns: (array) List of user IDs.

WP: Gets the auto_toggle setting.
$id The category to get. If no category supplied uses 0
Returns: (int) Only returns 0.

WP: Get all available languages based on the presence of *.mo files in a given directory.
$dir A directory to search for language files. Default WP_LANG_DIR.
Returns: (string[]) An array of language codes or an empty array if no languages are present. Language codes are formed by stripping the.mo extension from the language file names.

WP: Get all available post MIME types for a given post type.
$type
Returns: (mixed)

WP: Get all the possible statuses for a post_type
$type The post_type you want the statuses for.
Returns: (string[]) An array of all the statuses for the supplied post type.

WP: Retrieve the avatar tag for a user, email address, MD5 hash, comment, or post. $id_or_email The Gravatar to retrieve. Accepts a user_id, gravatar md5 hash, user email, WP_User object, WP_Post object, or WP_Comment object. $size Height and width of the avatar image file in pixels. $default URL for the default image or a default type. Accepts '404' (return a 404 instead of a default image), 'retro' (8bit), 'monsterid' (monster), 'wavatar' (cartoon face), 'indenticon' (the "quilt"), 'mystery', 'mm', or 'mysteryman' (The Oyster Man), 'blank' (transparent GIF), or 'gravatar_default' (the Gravatar logo). Default is the value of the 'avatar_default' option, with a fallback of 'mystery'. $alt Alternative text to use in img tag. $args Extra arguments to retrieve the avatar. 'height'(int) Display height of the avatar in pixels. Defaults to $size. 'width'(int) Display width of the avatar in pixels. Defaults to $size. 'force_default'(bool) Whether to always show the default image, never the Gravatar. Default false. 'rating'(string) What rating to display avatars up to. Accepts 'G', 'PG', 'R', 'X', and are judged in that order. Default is the value of the 'avatar_rating' option. 'scheme'(string) URL scheme to use. See set_url_scheme() for accepted values. 'class'(array|string) Array or string of additional classes to add to the img element. 'force_display'(bool) Whether to always show the avatar ignores the show_avatars option. Default false. 'loading'(string) Value for the loading attribute. 'extra_attr'(string) HTML attributes to insert in the IMG element. Is not sanitized. Default empty. Returns: (string|false) tag for the user's avatar. False on failure.

WP: Retrieves default data about the avatar.
$id_or_email The Gravatar to retrieve. Accepts a user ID, Gravatar MD5 hash, user email, WP_User object, WP_Post object, or WP_Comment object.
$args Arguments to return instead of the default arguments. 'size'(int) Height and width of the avatar image file in pixels. Default 96. 'height'(int) Display height of the avatar in pixels. Defaults to $size. 'width'(int) Display width of the avatar in pixels. Defaults to $size. 'default'(string) URL for the default image or a default type. Accepts '404' (return a 404 instead of a default image), 'retro' (8bit), 'monsterid' (monster), 'wavatar' (cartoon face), 'indenticon' (the "quilt"), 'mystery', 'mm', or 'mysteryman' (The Oyster Man), 'blank' (transparent GIF), or 'gravatar_default' (the Gravatar logo). Default is the value of the 'avatar_default' option, with a fallback of 'mystery'. 'force_default'(bool) Whether to always show the default image, never the Gravatar. Default false. 'rating'(string) What rating to display avatars up to. Accepts 'G', 'PG', 'R', 'X', and are judged in that order. Default is the value of the 'avatar_rating' option. 'scheme'(string) URL scheme to use. See set_url_scheme() for accepted values. 'processed_args'(array) When the function returns, the value will be the processed/sanitized $args plus a "found_avatar" guess. Pass as a reference. 'extra_attr'(string) HTML attributes to insert in the IMG element. Is not sanitized. Default empty.
Returns: (array) Along with the arguments passed in $args, this will contain a couple of extra arguments.

WP: Retrieves the avatar URL.
$id_or_email The Gravatar to retrieve a URL for. Accepts a user_id, gravatar md5 hash, user email, WP_User object, WP_Post object, or WP_Comment object.
$args Arguments to return instead of the default arguments. 'size'(int) Height and width of the avatar in pixels. Default 96. 'default'(string) URL for the default image or a default type. Accepts '404' (return a 404 instead of a default image), 'retro' (8bit), 'monsterid' (monster), 'wavatar' (cartoon face), 'indenticon' (the "quilt"), 'mystery', 'mm', or 'mysteryman' (The Oyster Man), 'blank' (transparent GIF), or 'gravatar_default' (the Gravatar logo). Default is the value of the 'avatar_default' option, with a fallback of 'mystery'. 'force_default'(bool) Whether to always show the default image, never the Gravatar. Default false. 'rating'(string) What rating to display avatars up to. Accepts 'G', 'PG', 'R', 'X', and are judged in that order. Default is the value of the 'avatar_rating' option. 'scheme'(string) URL scheme to use. See set_url_scheme() for accepted values. 'processed_args'(array) When the function returns, the value will be the processed/sanitized $args plus a "found_avatar" guess. Pass as a reference.
Returns: (string|false) The URL of the avatar on success, false on failure.

WP: Retrieves value for custom background color.
Returns: (string)

WP: Retrieves background image for custom background.
Returns: (string)

WP: Returns all the categories for block types that will be shown in the block editor.
$post_or_block_editor_context The current post object or the block editor context.
Returns: (array[]) Array of categories for block types.

WP: Prepares server-registered blocks for the block editor.
Returns: (array) An associative array of registered block data.

WP: Returns the contextualized block editor settings for a selected editor context.
$custom_settings Custom settings to use with the given editor type.
$block_editor_context The current block editor context.
Returns: (array) The contextualized block editor settings.

WP: Creates an array of theme styles to load into the block editor.
Returns: (array) An array of theme styles for the block editor. Includes default font family style and theme stylesheets.

WP: Retrieves a single unified template object using its id.
$id Template unique identifier (example: theme_slug//template_slug).
$template_type wp_template.
Returns: (WP_Block_Template|null) Template.

WP: Retrieves a list of unified template objects based on a query.
$query Arguments to retrieve templates. 'slug__in'(array) List of slugs to include. 'wp_id'(int) Post ID of customized template.
$template_type The template type (post type).
Returns: (WP_Block_Template[]) Block template objects.

WP: Generates a string of attributes by applying to the current block being rendered all of the features that the block supports.
$extra_attributes Extra attributes to render on the block wrapper.
Returns: (string) String of HTML classes.

WP: Get a full blog URL, given a domain and a path.
$domain
$path
Returns: (string)

WP: Get a full blog URL, given a blog ID.
$blog_id Blog ID.
Returns: (string) Full URL of the blog if found. Empty string if not.

WP: Get a full blog URL, given a blog name.
$blogname The (subdomain or directory) name
Returns: (string)

WP: Retrieves information about the current site.
$show Site info to retrieve. Default empty (site name).
$filter How to filter what is retrieved.
Returns: (string) Mostly string values, might be empty.

WP: RSS container for the bloginfo function.
$show See get_bloginfo() for possible values.
Returns: (string)

WP: Get the sites a user belongs to.
$user_id User ID
$all Whether to retrieve all sites, or only sites that are not marked as deleted, archived, or spam.
Returns: (object[]) A list of the user's sites. An empty array if the user doesn't exist or belongs to no sites.

WP: The number of active sites on your installation.
$network_id ID of the network. Default is the current network.
Returns: (int) Number of active sites on the network.

WP: Retrieve the details for a blog from the blogs table and blog options.
$fields A blog ID, a blog slug, or an array of fields to query against. If not specified the current blog ID is used.
$get_all Whether to retrieve all details or only the details in the blogs table. Default is true.
Returns: (WP_Site|false) Blog details on success. False on failure.

WP: Get a blog’s numeric ID from its URL.
$domain
$path Not required for subdomain installations.
Returns: (int) 0 if no blog found, otherwise the ID of the matching blog

WP: Deprecated functionality to retrieve a list of all sites.
$start Offset for retrieving the blog list. Default 0.
$num Number of blogs to list.
$deprecated Unused.
Returns: (void)

WP: Retrieve option value for a given blog id based on name of option.
$id A blog ID. Can be null to refer to the current blog.
$option Name of option to retrieve. Expected to not be SQL-escaped.
$default Default value to return if the option does not exist.
Returns: (mixed) Value set for the option.

WP: Get the permalink for a post on another blog.
$blog_id ID of the source blog.
$post_id ID of the desired post.
Returns: (string) The post's permalink

WP: Gets a blog post from any site on the network.
$blog_id ID of the blog.
$post_id ID of the post being looked for.
Returns: (WP_Post|null) WP_Post object on success, null on failure

WP: Get a blog details field.
$id Blog ID.
$pref Field name.
Returns: (bool|string|null) $value

WP: Retrieves an array of the class names for the body element.
$class Space-separated string or array of class names to add to the class list.
Returns: (string[]) Array of class names.

WP: Retrieve Bookmark data
$bookmark
$output The required return type. One of OBJECT, ARRAY_A, or ARRAY_N, which correspond to an stdClass object, an associative array, or a numeric array, respectively.
$filter How to sanitize bookmark fields.
Returns: (array|object|null) Type returned depends on $output value.

WP: Retrieves the list of bookmarks
$args String or array of arguments to retrieve bookmarks. 'orderby'(string) How to order the links by. Accepts 'id', 'link_id', 'name', 'link_name', 'url', 'link_url', 'visible', 'link_visible', 'rating', 'link_rating', 'owner', 'link_owner', 'updated', 'link_updated', 'notes', 'link_notes', 'description', 'link_description', 'length' and 'rand'. When $orderby is 'length', orders by the character length of 'link_name'. Default 'name'. 'order'(string) Whether to order bookmarks in ascending or descending order. Accepts 'ASC' (ascending) or 'DESC' (descending). Default 'ASC'. 'limit'(int) Amount of bookmarks to display. Accepts any positive number or -1 for all. Default -1. 'category'(string) Comma-separated list of category IDs to include links from. 'category_name'(string) Category to retrieve links for by name. 'hide_invisible'(int|bool) Whether to show or hide links marked as 'invisible'. Accepts 1|true or 0|false. Default 1|true. 'show_updated'(int|bool) Whether to display the time the bookmark was last updated. Accepts 1|true or 0|false. Default 0|false. 'include'(string) Comma-separated list of bookmark IDs to include. 'exclude'(string) Comma-separated list of bookmark IDs to exclude. 'search'(string) Search terms. Will be SQL-formatted with wildcards before and after and searched in 'link_url', 'link_name' and 'link_description'.
Returns: (object[]) List of bookmark row objects.

WP: Retrieve single bookmark data item or field.
$field The name of the data field to return.
$bookmark The bookmark ID to get field.
$context The context of how the field will be used.
Returns: (string|WP_Error)

WP: Retrieves the boundary post.
$in_same_term Whether returned post should be in a same taxonomy term.
$excluded_terms Array or comma-separated list of excluded term IDs.
$start Whether to retrieve first or last post. Default true
$taxonomy Taxonomy, if $in_same_term is true.
Returns: (null|array) Array containing the boundary post object if successful, null otherwise.

WP: Get boundary post relational link.
$title Link title format.
$in_same_cat Whether link should be in a same category.
$excluded_categories Excluded categories IDs.
$start Whether to display link to first or last post.
Returns: (string)

WP: Retrieves a list of broken themes.
Returns: (array)

WP: Display calendar with days that have posts as links.

$echo Whether to display the calendar output.
Returns: (void|string) Void if $echo argument is true, calendar HTML if $echo is false.

WP: Retrieves HTML content for cancel comment reply link.

WP: Retrieves a list of category objects.
$args Arguments to retrieve categories. See get_terms() for additional options. 'taxonomy'(string) Taxonomy to retrieve terms for. Default 'category'.

WP: Retrieves category data given a category ID or category object.

$filter How to sanitize category fields.
Returns: (object|array|WP_Error|null) Category data in type defined by $output parameter. WP_Error if $category is empty, null if it does not exist.

WP: Retrieves a category based on URL containing the category slug.
$category_path URL containing category slugs.

$output The required return type. One of OBJECT, ARRAY_A, or ARRAY_N, which correspond to a WP_Term object, an associative array, or a numeric array, respectively.
Returns: (WP_Term|array|WP_Error|null) Type is based on $output value.

WP: Retrieves a category object by category slug.

Returns: (object|false) Category data object on success, false if not found.

WP: Retrieve category children list separated before and after the term IDs.

Returns: (string) Link to the feed for the category specified by $cat_id.

Returns: (string) Link on success, empty string if category does not exist.

$link Whether to format with link.
$separator How to separate categories.
$nicename Whether to use nice name for display.
$deprecated Not used.
Returns: (string|WP_Error) A list of category parents on success, WP_Error on failure.

WP: Print/Return link to category RSS2 feed.
$echo
$cat_ID
Returns: (string)

WP: Retrieve path of category template in current or parent template.

WP: Get category object for given ID and ‘edit’ filter context.
$id
Returns: (object)

WP: Retrieve the category name by the category ID.

Returns: (string) category name

WP: Retrieves the ID of a category from its name.

Returns: (int) Category ID on success, 0 if the category doesn't exist.

WP: Retrieves the name of a category from its ID.

Returns: (string) Category name, or an empty string if the category doesn't exist.

WP: Retrieve all children of the post parent ID.
$args User defined arguments for replacing the defaults.
$output The required return type. One of OBJECT, ARRAY_A, or ARRAY_N, which correspond to a WP_Post object, an associative array, or a numeric array, respectively.
Returns: (WP_Post[]|int[]) Array of post objects or post IDs.

WP: Get base domain of network.
Returns: (string) Base domain.

WP: Returns value of command line params.
$param
$required
Returns: (mixed)

WP: Get the column headers for a screen
$screen The screen you want the headers for
Returns: (string[]) The column header labels keyed by column ID.

WP: Retrieves comment data given a comment ID or comment object.
$comment Comment to retrieve.
$output The required return type. One of OBJECT, ARRAY_A, or ARRAY_N, which correspond to a WP_Comment object, an associative array, or a numeric array, respectively.
Returns: (WP_Comment|array|null) Depends on $output value.

WP: Retrieve an array of comment data about comment $comment_ID.
$comment_ID The ID of the comment
$no_cache Whether to use the cache (cast to bool)
$include_unapproved Whether to include unapproved comments
Returns: (array) The comment data

WP: Retrieve a list of comments.
$args Array or string of arguments. See WP_Comment_Query::__construct() for information on accepted arguments.
Returns: (int|array) List of comments or number of found comments if $count argument is true.

WP: Retrieves the link to the current post comments.
$post_id Post ID or WP_Post object. Default is global $post.
Returns: (string) The link to the comments.

WP: Retrieves the amount of comments a post has.
$post_id Post ID or WP_Post object. Default is the global $post.
Returns: (string|int) If the post exists, a numeric string representing the number of comments the post has, otherwise 0.

WP: Displays the language string for the number of comments the current post has.
$zero Text for no comments.
$one Text for one comment.
$more Text for more than one comment.
$post_id Post ID or WP_Post object. Default is the global $post.
Returns: (string) Language string for the number of comments a post has.

WP: Retrieves the comments page number link.
$pagenum Page number.
$max_page The maximum number of comment pages. Default 0.
Returns: (string) The comments page number link URL.

WP: Retrieve path of comment popup template in current or parent template.
Returns: (string) Full path to comments popup template file.

WP: Retrieves the author of the current comment.
$comment_ID WP_Comment or the ID of the comment for which to retrieve the author. Default current comment.
Returns: (string) The comment author

WP: Retrieves the email of the author of the current comment.
$comment_ID WP_Comment or the ID of the comment for which to get the author's email. Default current comment.
Returns: (string) The current comment author's email

WP: Returns the HTML email link to the author of the current comment.
$linktext Text to display instead of the comment author's email address.
$before Text or HTML to display before the email link.
$after Text or HTML to display after the email link.
$comment Comment ID or WP_Comment object. Default is the current comment.
Returns: (string) HTML markup for the comment author email link. By default, the email address is obfuscated via the 'comment_email' filter with antispambot().

WP: Retrieve the IP address of the author of the current comment.
$comment_ID WP_Comment or the ID of the comment for which to get the author's IP address. Default current comment.
Returns: (string) Comment author's IP address.

WP: Retrieves the HTML link to the URL of the author of the current comment.
$comment_ID WP_Comment or the ID of the comment for which to get the author's link. Default current comment.
Returns: (string) The comment author name or HTML link for author's URL.

WP: Retrieve the current comment author for use in the feeds.
Returns: (string) Comment Author

WP: Retrieves the URL of the author of the current comment, not linked.
$comment_ID WP_Comment or the ID of the comment for which to get the author's URL. Default current comment.
Returns: (string) Comment author URL, if provided, an empty string otherwise.

WP: Retrieves the HTML link of the URL of the author of the current comment.
$linktext The text to display instead of the comment author's email address.
$before The text or HTML to display before the email link.
$after The text or HTML to display after the email link.
$comment Comment ID or WP_Comment object. Default is the current comment.
Returns: (string) The HTML link between the $before and $after parameters.

WP: Returns the classes for the comment div as an array.
$class One or more classes to add to the class list.
$comment_id Comment ID or WP_Comment object. Default current comment.
$post_id Post ID or WP_Post object. Default current post.
Returns: (string[]) An array of classes.

WP: Retrieves the total comment counts for the whole site or a single post.
$post_id Restrict the comment counts to the given post. Default 0, which indicates that comment counts for the whole site will be retrieved.
Returns: (array()) The number of comments keyed by their status.

WP: Retrieves the comment date of the current comment.
$format PHP date format. Defaults to the 'date_format' option.
$comment_ID WP_Comment or ID of the comment for which to get the date. Default current comment.
Returns: (string) The comment's date.

WP: Returns the content of a block, including comment delimiters.
$block_name Block name. Null if the block name is unknown, e.g. Classic blocks have their name set to null.
$block_attributes Block attributes.
$block_content Block save content.
Returns: (string) Comment-delimited block content.

WP: Retrieves the excerpt of the given comment.
$comment_ID WP_Comment or ID of the comment for which to get the excerpt. Default current comment.
Returns: (string) The possibly truncated comment excerpt.

WP: Retrieve the feed GUID for the current comment.
$comment_id comment object or ID. Defaults to global comment object.
Returns: (string|false) GUID for comment on success, false on failure.

WP: Retrieves the comment ID of the current comment.
Returns: (int) The comment ID.

WP: Retrieves hidden input HTML for replying to comments.
$post_id Post ID. Defaults to the current post ID.
Returns: (string) Hidden input HTML for replying to comments.

WP: Retrieves the link to a given comment.
$comment Comment to retrieve. Default current comment.
$args An array of optional arguments to override the defaults. 'type'(string) Passed to get_page_of_comment(). 'page'(int) Current page of comments, for calculating comment pagination. 'per_page'(int) Per-page value for comment pagination. 'max_depth'(int) Passed to get_page_of_comment(). 'cpage'(int|string) Value to use for the comment's "comment-page" or "cpage" value. If provided, this value overrides any value calculated from $page and $per_page.
Returns: (string) The permalink to the given comment.

WP: Retrieve comment meta field for a comment.
$comment_id Comment ID.
$key The meta key to retrieve. By default, returns data for all keys.
$single Whether to return a single value. This parameter has no effect if $key is not specified.
Returns: (mixed) An array of values if $single is false. The value of meta data field if $single is true. False for an invalid $comment_id (non-numeric, zero, or negative value). An empty string if a valid but non-existing comment ID is passed.

WP: Calculate the total number of comment pages.
$comments Array of WP_Comment objects. Defaults to $wp_query->comments.
$per_page Comments per page.
$threaded Control over flat or threaded comments.
Returns: (int) Number of comment pages.

WP: Retrieves HTML content for reply to comment link.
$args Override default arguments. 'add_below'(string) The first part of the selector used to identify the comment to respond below. The resulting value is passed as the first parameter to addComment.moveForm(), concatenated as $add_below-$comment->comment_ID. Default 'comment'. 'respond_id'(string) The selector identifying the responding comment. Passed as the third parameter to addComment.moveForm(), and appended to the link URL as a hash value. Default 'respond'. 'reply_text'(string) The text of the Reply link. Default 'Reply'. 'login_text'(string) The text of the link to reply if logged out. Default 'Log in to Reply'. 'max_depth'(int) The max depth of the comment tree. Default 0. 'depth'(int) The depth of the new comment. Must be greater than 0 and less than the value of the 'thread_comments_depth' option set in Settings > Discussion. Default 0. 'before'(string) The text or HTML to add before the reply link. 'after'(string) The text or HTML to add after the reply link.
$comment Comment being replied to. Default current comment.
$post Post ID or WP_Post object the comment is going to be displayed on. Default current post.
Returns: (string|false|null) Link to show comment form, if successful. False, if comments are closed.

WP: Retrieve all of the WordPress supported comment statuses.
Returns: (string[]) List of comment status labels keyed by status.

WP: Retrieves the text of the current comment.
$comment_ID WP_Comment or ID of the comment for which to get the text. Default current comment.
$args An array of arguments.
Returns: (string) The comment content.

WP: Retrieves the comment time of the current comment.
$format PHP time format. Defaults to the 'time_format' option.
$gmt Whether to use the GMT date.
$translate Whether to translate the time (for use in feeds).
Returns: (string) The formatted time.

WP: Returns a WP_Comment object based on comment ID.

Returns: (WP_Comment|false) Comment if found. False on failure.

WP: Retrieves the comment type of the current comment.

WP: Gets and caches the checksums for the given version of WordPress.

Returns: (array|false) An array of checksums on success, false on failure.

WP: Gets available core updates.

Returns: (array|false) Array of the update objects on success, false on failure.

WP: Populate global variables with information about the currently logged in user.
Returns: (bool|WP_User) False on XMLRPC Request and invalid auth cookie, WP_User instance otherwise.

WP: Retrieve the current site ID.
Returns: (int) Site ID.

WP: Retrieves the current network ID.
Returns: (int) The ID of the current network.

WP: Get the current screen object
Returns: (WP_Screen|null) Current screen object or null when screen not defined.

WP: Get the current network.
Returns: (WP_Network)

WP: This deprecated function formerly set the site_name property of the $current_site object.
$current_site
Returns: (WP_Network)

WP: Retrieve current theme name.
Returns: (string)

WP: Get the current user’s ID
Returns: (int) The current user's ID, or 0 if no user is logged in.

WP: Gets the header image data.
Returns: (object)

WP: Retrieves the markup for a custom header.
Returns: (string) The markup for a custom header on success.

WP: Returns a custom logo, linked to home unless the theme supports removing the link on the home page.
$blog_id ID of the blog in question. Default is the ID of the current blog.
Returns: (string) Custom logo markup.

WP: Get the "dashboard blog", the blog where users without a blog edit their profile data.
Returns: (WP_Site) Current site object.

WP: Retrieves the URL to the user’s dashboard.
$user_id User ID. Defaults to current user.
$path path relative to the dashboard. Use only paths known to both site and user admins.
$scheme The scheme to use. Default is 'admin', which obeys force_ssl_admin() and is_ssl(). 'http' or 'https' can be passed to force those schemes.
Returns: (string) Dashboard URL link with optional path appended.

WP: Given a date in UTC or GMT timezone, returns that date in the timezone of the site.
$string The date to be converted, in UTC or GMT timezone.
$format The format string for the returned date.
Returns: (string) Formatted version of the date, in the site's timezone.

WP: Retrieve path of date template in current or parent template.
Returns: (string) Full path to date template file.

WP: Retrieves the permalink for the day archives with year and month.
$year Integer of year. False for current year.
$month Integer of month. False for current month.
$day Integer of day. False for current day.
Returns: (string) The permalink for the specified day, month, and year archive.

WP: Returns the list of default categories for block types.
Returns: (array[]) Array of categories for block types.

WP: Returns the default block editor settings.
Returns: (array) The default block editor settings.

WP: Gets the default comment status for a post type.

Returns: (string) Expected return value is 'open' or 'closed'.

Returns: (WP_Post) Post object containing all the default post data as attributes

Returns: (string|void) The delete post link URL for the given post.

WP: Get the size of a directory.

$max_execution_time Maximum time to run before giving up. In seconds. The timeout is global and is measured from the moment WordPress started to load.
Returns: (int|false|null) Size in bytes if a valid directory. False if not. Null if timeout.

WP: Check the wp-content directory and retrieve all drop-ins with any plugin data.

WP: Retrieves the URL to the user’s profile editor.

Returns: (string|null) The edit term link URL for the given term, or null on failure.

WP: Retrieves an embed template path in the current or parent template.

WP: Retrieves the most recent time that a post on the site was published.
$timezone The timezone for the timestamp. Accepts 'server', 'blog', or 'gmt'. 'server' uses the server's internal timezone. 'blog' uses the post_date field, which proxies to the timezone set for the site. 'gmt' uses the post_date_gmt field.
$post_type The post type to check.
Returns: (string) The date of the last post, or false on failure.

WP: Get the most recent time that a post on the site was modified.
$timezone The timezone for the timestamp. See get_lastpostdate() for information on accepted values.
$post_type The post type to check.
Returns: (string) The timestamp in 'Y-m-d H:i:s' format, or false on failure.

WP: Get a list of most recently updated blogs.

Returns: (array) The list of blogs.

WP: Returns the block editor settings needed to use the Legacy Widget block which is not registered by default.

WP: Retrieves bookmark data based on ID.

Returns: (object|array) Bookmark object or array, depending on the type specified by $output.

WP: Gets the name of category by ID.

Returns: (string)

WP: Gets an array of link objects associated with category n.
$category The category to use. If no category supplied, uses all. Default 0.
$orderby The order to output the links. E.g. 'id', 'name', 'url', 'description', 'rating', or 'owner'. If you start the name with an underscore, the order will be reversed. Specifying 'rand' as the order will return links in a random order.
$limit Limit to X entries. If not specified, all entries are shown. Default 0.
Returns: (array)

WP: Gets an array of link objects associated with category $cat_name.
$cat_name The category name to use. If no match is found, uses all. Default 'noname'.
$orderby The order to output the links. E.g. 'id', 'name', 'url', 'description', 'rating', or 'owner'. If you start the name with an underscore, the order will be reversed. Specifying 'rand' as the order will return links in a random order.
$limit Limit to X entries. If not specified, all entries are shown.
Returns: (array)

WP: Legacy function that retrieved the value of a link’s link_rating field.
$link Link object.
Returns: (mixed) Value of the 'link_rating' field, false otherwise.

WP: Gets the links associated with category by ID. $category The category to use. If no category supplied uses all. Default 0. $before The HTML to output before the link. $after The HTML to output after the link. Default
. $between The HTML to output between the link/image and its description. Not used if no image or $show_images is true. $show_images Whether to show images (if defined). $orderby The order to output the links. E.g. 'id', 'name', 'url', 'description', 'rating', or 'owner'. If you start the name with an underscore, the order will be reversed. Specifying 'rand' as the order will return links in a random order. $show_description Whether to show the description if show_images=false/not defined. $show_rating Show rating stars/chars. $limit Limit to X entries. If not specified, all entries are shown. $show_updated Whether to show last updated timestamp. $echo Whether to echo the results, or return them instead. Returns: (null|string)

WP: Gets the links associated with category $cat_name. $cat_name The category name to use. If no match is found, uses all. Default 'noname'. $before The HTML to output before the link. $after The HTML to output after the link. Default
. $between The HTML to output between the link/image and its description. Not used if no image or $show_images is true. Default ' '. $show_images Whether to show images (if defined). $orderby The order to output the links. E.g. 'id', 'name', 'url', 'description', 'rating', or 'owner'. If you start the name with an underscore, the order will be reversed. Specifying 'rand' as the order will return links in a random order. $show_description Whether to show the description if show_images=false/not defined. $show_rating Show rating stars/chars. $limit Limit to X entries. If not specified, all entries are shown. $show_updated Whether to show last updated timestamp. Default 0. Returns: (void)

WP: Gets the links associated with category ‘cat_name’ and display rating stars/chars. $cat_name The category name to use. If no match is found, uses all. Default 'noname'. $before The HTML to output before the link. $after The HTML to output after the link. Default
. $between The HTML to output between the link/image and its description. Not used if no image or $show_images is true. Default ' '. $show_images Whether to show images (if defined). $orderby The order to output the links. E.g. 'id', 'name', 'url', 'description', 'rating', or 'owner'. If you start the name with an underscore, the order will be reversed. Specifying 'rand' as the order will return links in a random order. $show_description Whether to show the description if show_images=false/not defined. $limit Limit to X entries. If not specified, all entries are shown. $show_updated Whether to show last updated timestamp. Default 0. Returns: (void)

WP: Output entire list of links by category.
$order Sort link categories by 'name' or 'id'
Returns: (void)

WP: Gets the links associated with category n and display rating stars/chars. $category The category to use. If no category supplied, uses all. Default 0. $before The HTML to output before the link. $after The HTML to output after the link. Default
. $between The HTML to output between the link/image and its description. Not used if no image or $show_images is true. Default ' '. $show_images Whether to show images (if defined). $orderby The order to output the links. E.g. 'id', 'name', 'url', 'description', 'rating', or 'owner'. If you start the name with an underscore, the order will be reversed. Specifying 'rand' as the order will return links in a random order. $show_description Whether to show the description if show_images=false/not defined. $limit Limit to X entries. If not specified, all entries are shown. $show_updated Whether to show last updated timestamp. Default 0. Returns: (void)

WP: Retrieves the value of a metadata field for the specified object type and ID.
$meta_type Type of object metadata is for. Accepts 'post', 'comment', 'term', 'user', or any other object type with an associated meta table.
$object_id ID of the object metadata is for.
$meta_key Metadata key. If not specified, retrieve all metadata for the specified object.
$single If true, return only the first value of the specified $meta_key. This parameter has no effect if $meta_key is not specified.
Returns: (mixed) An array of values if $single is false. The value of the meta field if $single is true. False for an invalid $object_id (non-numeric, zero, or negative value), or if $meta_type is not specified. An empty string if a valid but non-existing object ID is passed.

WP: Retrieves metadata by meta ID.

$meta_id ID for a specific meta row.
Returns: (stdClass|false) Metadata object, or boolean false if the metadata doesn't exist.

WP: Retrieves default metadata value for the specified meta key and object.
$meta_type Type of object metadata is for. Accepts 'post', 'comment', 'term', 'user', or any other object type with an associated meta table.
$object_id ID of the object metadata is for.
$meta_key Metadata key.
$single If true, return only the first value of the specified $meta_key. This parameter has no effect if $meta_key is not specified.
Returns: (mixed) An array of default values if $single is false. The default value of the meta field if $single is true.

WP: Retrieves raw metadata value for the specified object.
$meta_type Type of object metadata is for. Accepts 'post', 'comment', 'term', 'user', or any other object type with an associated meta table.
$object_id ID of the object metadata is for.
$meta_key Metadata key. If not specified, retrieve all metadata for the specified object.
$single If true, return only the first value of the specified $meta_key. This parameter has no effect if $meta_key is not specified.
Returns: (mixed) An array of values if $single is false. The value of the meta field if $single is true. False for an invalid $object_id (non-numeric, zero, or negative value), or if $meta_type is not specified. Null if the value does not exist.
