$url The URL that should be inspected for discovery <link> tags.
$args oEmbed remote get arguments.
Returns: (object|false) oEmbed response data if the URL does belong to the current site. False otherwise.

WP: Filters the oEmbed response data to return an iframe embed code.
$data The response data.
$post The post object.
$width The requested width.
$height The calculated height.
Returns: (array) The modified response data.

WP: Retrieves an option value based on an option name.
$option Name of the option to retrieve. Expected to not be SQL-escaped.
$default Default value to return if the option does not exist.
Returns: (mixed) Value of the option. A value of any type may be returned, including scalar (string, boolean, float, integer), null, array, object. Scalar and null values will be returned as strings as long as they originate from a database stored option value. If there is no option in the database, boolean false is returned.

WP: Retrieve drafts from other users.
$user_id User ID.
Returns: (array) List of drafts from other users.

WP: Retrieve pending review posts from other users.
$user_id User ID.
Returns: (array) List of posts with pending review post type from other users.

WP: Retrieves editable posts from other users.
$user_id User ID to not retrieve posts from.
$type Post type to retrieve. Accepts 'draft', 'pending' or 'any' (all).
Returns: (array) List of posts from others.

WP: Retrieves page data given a page ID or page object.
$page Page object or page ID. Passed by reference.
$output The required return type. One of OBJECT, ARRAY_A, or ARRAY_N, which correspond to a WP_Post object, an associative array, or a numeric array, respectively.
$filter How the return value should be filtered. Accepts 'raw', 'edit', 'db', 'display'.
Returns: (WP_Post|array|null) WP_Post or array on success, null on failure.

WP: Retrieve path of paged template in current or parent template.
Returns: (string) Full path to paged template file.

WP: Retrieves the link for a page number.
$pagenum Page number.
$escape Whether to escape the URL for display, with esc_url(). Defaults to true. Otherwise, prepares the URL with esc_url_raw().
Returns: (string) The link URL for the given page number.

WP: Retrieve an array of pages (or hierarchical post type items).
$args Array or string of arguments to retrieve pages. 'child_of'(int) Page ID to return child and grandchild pages of. Note: The value of $hierarchical has no bearing on whether $child_of returns hierarchical results. Default 0, or no restriction. 'sort_order'(string) How to sort retrieved pages. Accepts 'ASC', 'DESC'. Default 'ASC'. 'sort_column'(string) What columns to sort pages by, comma-separated. Accepts 'post_author', 'post_date', 'post_title', 'post_name', 'post_modified', 'menu_order', 'post_modified_gmt', 'post_parent', 'ID', 'rand', 'comment*count'. 'post*' can be omitted for any values that start with it. Default 'post_title'. 'hierarchical'(bool) Whether to return pages hierarchically. If false in conjunction with $child_of also being false, both arguments will be disregarded. Default true. 'exclude'(int[]) Array of page IDs to exclude. 'include'(int[]) Array of page IDs to include. Cannot be used with $child_of, $parent, $exclude, $meta_key, $meta_value, or $hierarchical. 'meta_key'(string) Only include pages with this meta key. 'meta_value'(string) Only include pages with this meta value. Requires $meta_key. 'authors'(string) A comma-separated list of author IDs. 'parent'(int) Page ID to return direct children of. Default -1, or no restriction. 'exclude_tree'(string|int[]) Comma-separated string or array of page IDs to exclude. 'number'(int) The number of pages to return. Default 0, or all pages. 'offset'(int) The number of pages to skip before returning. Requires $number. Default 0. 'post_type'(string) The post type to query. Default 'page'. 'post_status'(string|array) A comma-separated list or array of post statuses to include. Default 'publish'.
Returns: (WP_Post[]|int[]|false) Array of pages (or hierarchical post type items). Boolean false if the specified post type is not hierarchical or the specified status is not supported by the post type.

WP: Retrieves a page given its path.
$page_path Page path.
$output The required return type. One of OBJECT, ARRAY_A, or ARRAY_N, which correspond to a WP_Post object, an associative array, or a numeric array, respectively.
$post_type Post type or array of post types.
Returns: (WP_Post|array|null) WP_Post (or array) on success, or null on failure.

WP: Retrieve a page given its title.
$page_title Page title.
$output The required return type. One of OBJECT, ARRAY_A, or ARRAY_N, which correspond to a WP_Post object, an associative array, or a numeric array, respectively.
$post_type Post type or array of post types.
Returns: (WP_Post|array|null) WP_Post (or array) on success, or null on failure.

WP: Identify descendants of a given page ID in a list of page objects.
$page_id Page ID.
$pages List of page objects from which descendants should be identified.
Returns: (array) List of page children.

WP: Order the pages with children under parents in a flat list.
$pages Posts array (passed by reference).
$page_id Parent page ID. Default 0.
Returns: (string[]) Array of post names keyed by ID and arranged by hierarchy. Children immediately follow their parents.

WP: Retrieves the permalink for the current page or page ID.
$post Post ID or object. Default uses the global $post.
$leavename Whether to keep the page name.
$sample Whether it should be treated as a sample permalink.
Returns: (string) The page permalink.

WP: Calculate what page number a comment will appear on for comment paging.
$comment_ID Comment ID.
$args Array of optional arguments. 'type'(string) Limit paginated comments to those matching a given type. Accepts 'comment', 'trackback', 'pingback', 'pings' (trackbacks and pingbacks), or 'all'. Default 'all'. 'per_page'(int) Per-page count to use when calculating pagination. Defaults to the value of the 'comments_per_page' option. 'max_depth'(int|string) If greater than 1, comment page will be determined for the top-level parent $comment_ID. Defaults to the value of the 'thread_comments_depth' option.
Returns: (int|null) Comment page number or null on error.

WP: Retrieve all of the WordPress support page statuses.
Returns: (string[]) Array of page status labels keyed by their status.

WP: Retrieve path of page template in current or parent template.
Returns: (string) Full path to page template file.

WP: Gets the page templates available in this theme.
$post The post being edited, provided for context.
$post_type Post type to get the templates for.
Returns: (string[]) Array of template file names keyed by the template header name.

WP: Get the specific template filename for a given post.
$post Post ID or WP_Post object. Default is global $post.
Returns: (string|false) Page template filename. Returns an empty string when the default page template is in use. Returns false if the post does not exist.

WP: Build the URI path for a page.
$page Page ID or WP_Post object. Default is global $post.
Returns: (string|false) Page URI, false on error.

WP: Get parent post relational link.
$title Link title format.
Returns: (string)

WP: Retrieves the path of a file in the parent theme.
$file File to return the path for in the template directory.
Returns: (string) The path of the file.

WP: Retrieves the URL of a file in the parent theme.
$file File to return the URL for in the template directory.
Returns: (string) The URL of the file.

WP: Creates, stores, then returns a password reset key for user.
$user User to retrieve password reset key for.
Returns: (string|WP_Error) Password reset key on success. WP_Error on error.

WP: Get the number of pending comments on a post or posts
$post_id Either a single Post ID or an array of Post IDs
Returns: (int|int[]) Either a single Posts pending comments as an int or an array of ints keyed on the Post IDs

WP: Retrieves the full permalink for the current post or post ID.
$post Post ID or post object. Default is the global $post.
$leavename Whether to keep post name or page name.
Returns: (string|false) The permalink URL or false if post does not exist.

WP: Check the plugins directory and retrieve all plugin files with plugin data.
$plugin_folder Relative path to single plugin folder.
Returns: (array[]) Array of arrays of plugin data, keyed by plugin file name. See get_plugin_data().

WP: Parses the plugin contents to retrieve plugin’s metadata.
$plugin_file Absolute path to the main plugin file.
$markup If the returned data should have HTML markup applied.
$translate If the returned data should be translated.
Returns: (array) Plugin data. Values will be empty if not supplied by the plugin.

WP: Get a list of a plugin’s files.
$plugin Path to the plugin file relative to the plugins directory.
Returns: (string[]) Array of file names relative to the plugin root.

WP: Gets the hook attached to the administrative page of a plugin.
$plugin_page The slug name of the plugin page.
$parent_page The slug name for the parent menu (or the file name of a standard WordPress admin page).
Returns: (string|null) Hook attached to the plugin page, null otherwise.

WP: Gets the hook name for the administrative page of a plugin.
$plugin_page The slug name of the plugin page.
$parent_page The slug name for the parent menu (or the file name of a standard WordPress admin page).
Returns: (string) Hook name for the plugin page.

WP: Retrieves post data given a post ID or post object.
$post Post ID or post object. null, false, 0 and other PHP falsey values return the current global post inside the loop. A numerically valid post ID that points to a non-existent post returns null. Defaults to global $post.
$output The required return type. One of OBJECT, ARRAY_A, or ARRAY_N, which correspond to a WP_Post object, an associative array, or a numeric array, respectively.
$filter Type of filter to apply. Accepts 'raw', 'edit', 'db', or 'display'.
Returns: (WP_Post|array|null) Type corresponding to $output on success or null on failure. When $output is OBJECT, a WP_Post instance is returned.

WP: Retrieves all post data for a given post.
$postid Post ID.
Returns: (array) Post data.

WP: Retrieves an array of the latest posts, or posts matching the given criteria.
$args Arguments to retrieve posts. See WP_Query::parse_query() for all available arguments. 'numberposts'(int) Total number of posts to retrieve. Is an alias of $posts_per_page in WP_Query. Accepts -1 for all. Default 5. 'category'(int|string) Category ID or comma-separated list of IDs (this or any children). Is an alias of $cat in WP_Query. Default 0. 'include'(int[]) An array of post IDs to retrieve, sticky posts will be included. Is an alias of $post__in in WP_Query. Default empty array. 'exclude'(int[]) An array of post IDs not to retrieve. Default empty array. 'suppress_filters'(bool) Whether to suppress filters. Default true.
Returns: (WP_Post[]|int[]) Array of post objects or post IDs.

WP: Retrieve the post SQL based on capability, author, and type.
$post_type Single post type or an array of post types.
$full Returns a full WHERE statement instead of just an 'andalso' term.
$post_author Query posts having a single author ID.
$public_only Only return public posts. Skips cap checks for $current_user.
Returns: (string) SQL WHERE code that can be added to a query.

WP: Retrieves the post pages link navigation for previous and next pages.
$args Arguments to build the post pages link navigation. 'sep'(string) Separator character. Default '—'. 'prelabel'(string) Link text to display for the previous page link. Default '« Previous Page'. 'nxtlabel'(string) Link text to display for the next page link. Default 'Next Page »'.
Returns: (string) The posts link navigation.

WP: Retrieves the IDs of the ancestors of a post.
$post Post ID or post object.
Returns: (int[]) Array of ancestor IDs or empty array if there are none.

WP: Retrieves an array of the class names for the post container element.
$class Space-separated string or array of class names to add to the class list.
$post_id Post ID or post object.
Returns: (string[]) Array of class names.

WP: Retrieves the permalink for the post comments feed.
$post_id Post ID. Default is the ID of the global $post.
$feed Feed type. Possible values include 'rss2', 'atom'. Default is the value of get_default_feed().
Returns: (string) The permalink for the comments feed for the given post on success, empty string on failure.

WP: Retrieve post meta fields, based on post ID.
$post_id Post ID. Default is ID of the global $post.
Returns: (array) Post meta for the given post.

WP: Retrieve meta field names for a post.
$post_id Post ID. Default is ID of the global $post.
Returns: (array|void) Array of the keys, if retrieved.

WP: Retrieve values for a custom post field.
$key Meta field key.
$post_id Post ID. Default is ID of the global $post.
Returns: (array|null) Meta field values.

WP: Retrieve post published or modified time as a DateTimeImmutable object instance.
$post WP_Post object or ID. Default is global $post object.
$field Published or modified time to use from database. Accepts 'date' or 'modified'.
$source Local or UTC time to use from database. Accepts 'local' or 'gmt'.
Returns: (DateTimeImmutable|false) Time object on success, false on failure.

WP: Retrieves the embed code for a specific post.
$width The width for the response.
$height The height for the response.
$post Post ID or object. Default is global $post.
Returns: (string|false) Embed code on success, false if post doesn't exist.

WP: Retrieves the URL to embed a specific post in an iframe.
$post Post ID or object. Defaults to the current post.
Returns: (string|false) The post embed URL on success, false if the post doesn't exist.

WP: Retrieve data from a post field based on Post ID.
$field Post field name.
$post Post ID or post object. Defaults to global $post.
$context How to filter the field. Accepts 'raw', 'edit', 'db', or 'display'.
Returns: (string) The value of the post field on success, empty string on failure.

WP: Retrieve the format slug for a post
$post Post ID or post object. Defaults to the current post in the loop.
Returns: (string|false) The format if successful. False otherwise.

WP: Returns a link to a post format index.
$format The post format slug.
Returns: (string|WP_Error|false) The post format term link.

WP: Retrieves the array of post format slugs.
Returns: (string[]) The array of post format slugs as both keys and values.

WP: Returns a pretty, translated version of a post format slug
$slug A post format slug.
Returns: (string) The translated post format name.

WP: Returns an array of post format slugs to their translated and pretty display versions
Returns: (string[]) Array of post format labels keyed by format slug.

WP: Retrieves galleries from the passed post’s content.
$post Post ID or object.
$html Whether to return HTML or data in the array.
Returns: (array) A list of arrays, each containing gallery data and srcs parsed from the expanded shortcode.

WP: Retrieve the image srcs from galleries from a post’s content, if present
$post Post ID or WP_Post object. Default is global $post.
Returns: (array) A list of lists, each containing image srcs parsed. from an expanded shortcode

WP: Check a specified post’s content for gallery and, if present, return the first
$post Post ID or WP_Post object. Default is global $post.
$html Whether to return HTML or data. Default is true.
Returns: (string|array) Gallery data and srcs parsed from the expanded shortcode.

WP: Checks a post’s content for galleries and return the image srcs for the first found gallery
$post Post ID or WP_Post object. Default is global $post.
Returns: (string[]) A list of a gallery's image srcs in order.

WP: Retrieves a post meta field for the given post ID.
$post_id Post ID.
$key The meta key to retrieve. By default, returns data for all keys.
$single Whether to return a single value. This parameter has no effect if $key is not specified.
Returns: (mixed) An array of values if $single is false. The value of the meta field if $single is true. False for an invalid $post_id (non-numeric, zero, or negative value). An empty string if a valid but non-existing post ID is passed.

WP: Get post meta data by meta ID.
$mid
Returns: (object|bool)

WP: Retrieve the mime type of an attachment based on the ID.
$post Post ID or post object. Defaults to global $post.
Returns: (string|false) The mime type on success, false on failure.

WP: Get default post mime types.
Returns: (array) List of post mime types.

WP: Retrieve the time at which the post was last modified.
$format Format to use for retrieving the time the post was modified. Accepts 'G', 'U', or PHP date format.
$gmt Whether to retrieve the GMT time.
$post WP_Post object or ID. Default is global $post object.
$translate Whether to translate the time string.
Returns: (string|int|false) Formatted date string or Unix timestamp if $format is 'U' or 'G'. False on failure.

WP: Retrieves the parent post object for the given post.
$post Post ID or WP_Post object. Default is global $post.
Returns: (WP_Post|null) Parent post object, or null if there isn't one.

WP: Retrieves the permalink for a post of a custom post type.
$id Post ID or post object. Default is the global $post.
$leavename Whether to keep post name.
$sample Is it a sample permalink.
Returns: (string|WP_Error) The post permalink.

WP: Retrieves HTML content for reply to post link.
$args Override default arguments. 'add_below'(string) The first part of the selector used to identify the comment to respond below. The resulting value is passed as the first parameter to addComment.moveForm(), concatenated as $add_below-$comment->comment_ID. Default is 'post'. 'respond_id'(string) The selector identifying the responding comment. Passed as the third parameter to addComment.moveForm(), and appended to the link URL as a hash value. Default 'respond'. 'reply_text'(string) Text of the Reply link. Default is 'Leave a Comment'. 'login_text'(string) Text of the link to reply if logged out. Default is 'Log in to leave a Comment'. 'before'(string) Text or HTML to add before the reply link. 'after'(string) Text or HTML to add after the reply link.
$post Post ID or WP_Post object the comment is going to be displayed on. Default current post.
Returns: (string|false|null) Link to show comment form, if successful. False, if comments are closed.

WP: Retrieves an array of post states from a post.
$post The post to retrieve states for.
Returns: (string[]) Array of post state labels keyed by their state.

WP: Get a list of post statuses.
$args Array or string of post status arguments to compare against properties of the global $wp_post_statuses objects.
$output The type of output to return, either 'names' or 'objects'.
$operator The logical operation to perform. 'or' means only one element from the array needs to match; 'and' means all elements must match.
Returns: (array) A list of post status names or objects.

WP: Retrieve the post status based on the post ID.
$post Post ID or post object. Defaults to global $post..
Returns: (string|false) Post status on success, false on failure.

WP: Retrieve all of the WordPress supported post statuses.
Returns: (string[]) Array of post status labels keyed by their status.

WP: Retrieve a post status object by name.
$post_status The name of a registered post status.
Returns: (object|null) A post status object.

WP: Retrieve all taxonomy names for the given post.
$post Post ID or WP_Post object. Default is global $post.
Returns: (string[]) An array of all taxonomy names for the given post.

WP: Retrieve post thumbnail ID.
$post Post ID or WP_Post object. Default is global $post.
Returns: (int|false) Post thumbnail ID (which can be 0 if the thumbnail is not set), or false if the post does not exist.

WP: Retrieve the time at which the post was written.
$format Format to use for retrieving the time the post was written. Accepts 'G', 'U', or PHP date format.
$gmt Whether to retrieve the GMT time.
$post WP_Post object or ID. Default is global $post object.
$translate Whether to translate the time string.
Returns: (string|int|false) Formatted date string or Unix timestamp if $format is 'U' or 'G'. False on failure.

WP: Retrieve post published or modified time as a Unix timestamp.
$post WP_Post object or ID. Default is global $post object.
$field Published or modified time to use from database. Accepts 'date' or 'modified'.
Returns: (int|false) Unix timestamp on success, false on failure.

WP: Gets an existing post and format it for editing.
$id
Returns: (WP_Post)

WP: Retrieves the post type of the current post or of a given post.
$post Post ID or post object. Default is global $post.
Returns: (string|false) Post type on success, false on failure.

WP: Get a list of all registered post type objects.
$args An array of key => value arguments to match against the post type objects.
$output The type of output to return. Accepts post type 'names' or 'objects'.
$operator The logical operation to perform. 'or' means only one element from the array needs to match; 'and' means all elements must match; 'not' means no elements may match.
Returns: (string[]|WP_Post_Type[]) An array of post type names or objects.

WP: Retrieves a list of post type names that support a specific feature.
$feature Single feature or an array of features the post types should support.
$operator The logical operation to perform. 'or' means only one element from the array needs to match; 'and' means all elements must match; 'not' means no elements may match.
Returns: (string[]) A list of post type names.

WP: Retrieves the permalink for a post type archive feed.
$post_type Post type.
$feed Feed type. Possible values include 'rss2', 'atom'. Default is the value of get_default_feed().
Returns: (string|false) The post type feed permalink. False if the post type does not exist or does not have an archive.

WP: Retrieves the permalink for a post type archive.
$post_type Post type.
Returns: (string|false) The post type archive permalink. False if the post type does not exist or does not have an archive.

WP: Retrieve path of post type archive template in current or parent template.
Returns: (string) Full path to archive template file.

WP: Build an object with all post type capabilities out of a post type object
$args Post type registration arguments.
Returns: (object) Object with all the capabilities as member variables.

WP: Builds an object with all post type labels out of a post type object.
$post_type_object Post type object.
Returns: (object) Object with all the labels as member variables.

WP: Retrieves a post type object by name.
$post_type The name of a registered post type.
Returns: (WP_Post_Type|null) WP_Post_Type object if it exists, null otherwise.

WP: Selects the first update version from the update_core option.
Returns: (object|array|false) The response from the API on success, false on failure.

WP: Retrieves the URL used for the post preview.
$post Post ID or WP_Post object. Defaults to global $post.
$query_args Array of additional query args to be appended to the link.
$preview_link Base preview link to be used if it should differ from the post permalink.
Returns: (string|null) URL used for the post preview, or null if the post does not exist.

WP: Retrieves the link to the previous comments page.
$label Label for comments link text.
Returns: (string|void) HTML-formatted link for the previous page of comments.

WP: Gets the previous image link that has the same post parent.
$size Image size. Accepts any registered image size name, or an array of width and height values in pixels (in that order).
$text Link text.
Returns: (string) Markup for previous image link.

WP: Retrieves the previous post that is adjacent to the current post.
$in_same_term Whether post should be in a same taxonomy term.
$excluded_terms Array or comma-separated list of excluded term IDs.
$taxonomy Taxonomy, if $in_same_term is true.
Returns: (null|string|WP_Post) Post object if successful. Null if global $post is not set. Empty string if no corresponding post exists.

WP: Retrieves the previous posts page link.
$label Previous page link text.
Returns: (string|void) HTML-formatted previous page link.

WP: Retrieves the previous posts page link.
Returns: (string|void) The link for the previous posts page.

WP: Retrieves the previous post link that is adjacent to the current post.
$format Link anchor format. Default '« %link'.
$link Link permalink format.
$in_same_term Whether link should be in a same taxonomy term.
$excluded_terms Array or comma-separated list of excluded term IDs.
$taxonomy Taxonomy, if $in_same_term is true.
Returns: (string) The link URL of the previous post in relation to the current post.

WP: Retrieve path of Privacy Policy page template in current or parent template.
Returns: (string) Full path to privacy policy template file.

WP: Retrieves the URL to the privacy policy page.
Returns: (string) The URL to the privacy policy page. Empty string if it doesn't exist.

WP: Retrieve the private post SQL based on capability.
$post_type Single post type or an array of post types. Currently only supports 'post' or 'page'.
Returns: (string) SQL code that can be added to a where clause.

WP: Retrieve user data based on field.
$field User meta field.
$user User ID to retrieve the field for. Default false (current user).
Returns: (string) The author's field from the current author's DB object.

WP: Retrieve URLs already pinged for a post.
$post_id Post ID or object.
Returns: (string[]|false) Array of URLs already pinged for the given post, false if the post is not found.

WP: Retrieves the currently queried object.
Returns: (WP_Term|WP_Post_Type|WP_Post|WP_User|null) The queried object.

WP: Retrieves the ID of the currently queried object.
Returns: (int) ID of the queried object.

WP: Retrieve path to a template
$type Filename without extension.
$templates An optional list of template candidates.
Returns: (string) Full path to template file.

WP: Retrieves the value of a query variable in the WP_Query class.
$var The variable key to retrieve.
$default Value to return if the query variable is not set.
Returns: (mixed) Contents of the query variable.

WP: Gets random header image URL from registered images in theme.
Returns: (string) Path to header image.

WP: Gets the raw theme root relative to the content directory with no filters applied.
$stylesheet_or_template The stylesheet or template name of the theme.
$skip_cache Whether to skip the cache. Defaults to false, meaning the cache is used.
Returns: (string) Theme root.

WP: Get the real filesystem path to a file to edit within the admin.
$file Filesystem path relative to the wp-content directory.
Returns: (string) Full filesystem path to edit.

WP: Retrieves registered metadata for a specified object.
$object_type Type of object metadata is for. Accepts 'post', 'comment', 'term', 'user', or any other object type with an associated meta table.
$object_id ID of the object the metadata is for.
$meta_key Registered metadata key. If not specified, retrieve all registered metadata for the specified object.
Returns: (mixed) A single value or array of values for a key if specified. An array of all registered keys and values for an object ID if not. False if a given $meta_key is not registered.

WP: Retrieves a list of registered meta keys for an object type.
$object_type Type of object metadata is for. Accepts 'post', 'comment', 'term', 'user', or any other object type with an associated meta table.
$object_subtype The subtype of the object type.
Returns: (string[]) List of registered meta keys.

WP: Retrieves all registered navigation menu locations in a theme.
Returns: (string[]) Associative array of egistered navigation menu descriptions keyed by their location. If none are registered, an empty array.

WP: Retrieves an array of registered settings.
Returns: (array) List of registered settings, keyed by option name.

WP: Gets the registration config for a theme feature.
$feature The feature name. See add_theme_support() for the list of possible values.
Returns: (array|null) The registration args, or null if the feature was not registered.

WP: Gets the list of registered theme features.
Returns: (array[]) List of theme features, keyed by their name.

WP: Retrieves the URL to a REST endpoint on a site.
$blog_id Blog ID. Default of null returns URL for current blog.
$path REST route.
$scheme Sanitization scheme.
Returns: (string) Full URL to the endpoint.

WP: Retrieve role object.
$role Role name.
Returns: (WP_Role|null) WP_Role object if found, null if the role does not exist.

WP: Display RSS items in HTML list items.
$url URL of feed to display. Will not auto sense feed URL.
$num_items Number of items to display, default is all.
Returns: (bool) False on failure.

WP: Get a sample permalink based off of the post name.
$id Post ID or post object.
$title Title to override the post's current title when generating the post name.
$name Name to override the post name.
Returns: (array) Array containing the sample permalink with placeholder for the post name, and the post name.

WP: Returns the HTML of the sample permalink slug editor.
$id Post ID or post object.
$new_title New title.
$new_slug New slug.
Returns: (string) The HTML of the sample permalink slug editor.

WP: Retrieves the screen icon (no longer used in 3.8+).
Returns: (string) An HTML comment explaining that icons are no longer used.

WP: Retrieves the permalink for the search results comments feed.
$search_query Search query.
$feed Feed type. Possible values include 'rss2', 'atom'. Default is the value of get_default_feed().
Returns: (string) The comments feed search results permalink.

WP: Retrieves the permalink for the search results feed.
$search_query Search query.
$feed Feed type. Possible values include 'rss2', 'atom'. Default is the value of get_default_feed().
Returns: (string) The search results feed permalink.

WP: Display search form.
$args Array of display arguments. 'echo'(bool) Whether to echo or return the form. Default true. 'aria_label'(string) ARIA label for the search form. Useful to distinguish multiple search forms on the same page and improve accessibility.
Returns: (void|string) Void if 'echo' argument is true, search form HTML if 'echo' is false.

WP: Retrieves the permalink for a search.
$query The query string to use. If empty the current query is used.
Returns: (string) The search permalink.

WP: Retrieves the contents of the search WordPress query variable.
$escaped Whether the result is escaped. Only use when you are later escaping it. Do not use unescaped.
Returns: (string)

WP: Retrieve path of search template in current or parent template.
Returns: (string) Full path to search template file.

WP: Returns the link for the currently displayed feed.
Returns: (string) Correct link for the atom:self element.

WP: Get value based on option.
$option
Returns: (string)

WP: Fetch settings errors registered by add_settings_error().
$setting Slug title of a specific setting whose errors you want.
$sanitize Whether to re-sanitize the setting value before returning errors.
Returns: (array) Array of settings errors.

WP: Retrieve the shortcode attributes regex.
Returns: (string) The shortcode attribute regular expression

WP: Retrieve the shortcode regular expression for searching.
$tagnames List of shortcodes to find. Defaults to all registered shortcodes.
Returns: (string) The shortcode search regular expression

WP: Retrieves the Press This bookmarklet link.
Returns: (void)

WP: Load sidebar template.
$name The name of the specialised sidebar.
$args Additional arguments passed to the sidebar template.
Returns: (void|false) Void on success, false if the template does not exist.

WP: Retrieve path of single template in current or parent template. Applies to single Posts, single Attachments, and single custom post types.
Returns: (string) Full path to single template file.

WP: Retrieves the path of the singular template in current or parent template.
Returns: (string) Full path to singular template file

WP: Retrieves site data given a site ID or site object.
$site Site to retrieve. Default is the current site.
Returns: (WP_Site|null) The site object or null if not found.

WP: Retrieves the full URL for a sitemap.
$name The sitemap name.
$subtype_name The sitemap subtype name.
$page The page of the sitemap.
Returns: (string|false) The sitemap URL or false if the sitemap doesn't exist.

WP: Retrieves a list of sites matching requested arguments.
$args Array or string of arguments. See WP_Site_Query::__construct() for information on accepted arguments.
Returns: (array|int) List of WP_Site objects, a list of site IDs when 'fields' is set to 'ids', or the number of sites when 'count' is passed as a query var.

WP: Gets the network’s site and user counts.
Returns: (int[]) Site and user count for the network.

WP: Deprecated functionality for getting themes network-enabled themes.
Returns: (void)

WP: Retrieves the closest matching site object by its domain and path.
$domain Domain to check.
$path Path to check.
$segments Path segments to use. Defaults to null, or the full path.
Returns: (WP_Site|false) Site object if successful. False when no site is found.

WP: Returns the Site Icon URL.
$size Size of the site icon. Default 512 (pixels).
$url Fallback url if no site icon is found.
$blog_id ID of the blog to get the site icon for. Default current blog.
Returns: (string) Site Icon URL.

WP: Retrieves metadata for a site.
$site_id Site ID.
$key The meta key to retrieve. By default, returns data for all keys.
$single Whether to return a single value. This parameter has no effect if $key is not specified.
Returns: (mixed) An array of values if $single is false. The value of meta data field if $single is true. False for an invalid $site_id (non-numeric, zero, or negative value). An empty string if a valid but non-existing site ID is passed.

WP: Retrieve an option value for the current network based on name of option.
$option Name of the option to retrieve. Expected to not be SQL-escaped.
$default Value to return if the option doesn't exist.
$deprecated Whether to use cache. Multisite only. Always set to true.
Returns: (mixed) Value set for the option.

WP: Returns the content for the help sidebar on the Edit Site screens.
Returns: (string) Help sidebar content.

WP: Returns the arguments for the help tab on the Edit Site screens.
Returns: (array) Help tab arguments.

WP: Retrieves the value of a site transient.
$transient Transient name. Expected to not be SQL-escaped.
Returns: (mixed) Value of transient.

WP: Retrieves the URL for a given site where WordPress application files (e.g. wp-blog-header.php or the wp-admin/ folder) are accessible.
$blog_id Site ID. Default null (current site).
$path Path relative to the site URL.
$scheme Scheme to give the site URL context. Accepts 'http', 'https', 'login', 'login_post', 'admin', or 'relative'.
Returns: (string) Site URL link with optional path appended.

WP: Returns the upload quota for the current blog.
Returns: (int) Quota in megabytes

WP: Returns the space used by the current site.
Returns: (int) Used space in megabytes.

WP: Retrieve the description for the HTTP status.
$code HTTP status code.
Returns: (string) Status description if found, an empty string otherwise.

WP: Retrieves name of the current stylesheet.
Returns: (string) Stylesheet name.

WP: Retrieves stylesheet directory path for current theme.
Returns: (string) Path to current theme's stylesheet directory.

WP: Retrieves stylesheet directory URI for current theme.
Returns: (string) URI to current theme's stylesheet directory.

WP: Retrieves stylesheet URI for current theme.
Returns: (string) URI to current theme's stylesheet.

WP: Retrieves a list of reserved site on a sub-directory Multisite installation.
Returns: (string[]) Array of reserved names.

WP: Returns a submit button, with provided text and appropriate class
$text The text of the button. Default 'Save Changes'.
$type The type and CSS class(es) of the button. Core values include 'primary', 'small', and 'large'.
$name The HTML name of the submit button. Defaults to "submit". If no id attribute is given in $other_attributes below, $name will be used as the button's id.
$wrap True if the output button should be wrapped in a paragraph tag, false otherwise.
$other_attributes Other attributes that should be output with the button, mapping attributes to their values, such as array( 'tabindex' => '1' ). These attributes will be output as attribute="value", such as tabindex="1". Other attributes can also be provided as a string such as tabindex="1", though the array format is typically cleaner.
Returns: (string) Submit button HTML.

WP: Retrieve a list of super admins.
Returns: (string[]) List of super admin logins.

WP: Retrieves a post tag by tag ID or tag object.
$tag A tag ID or object.
$output The required return type. One of OBJECT, ARRAY_A, or ARRAY_N, which correspond to a WP_Term object, an associative array, or a numeric array, respectively.
$filter How to sanitize tag fields.
Returns: (WP_Term|array|WP_Error|null) Tag data in type defined by $output parameter. WP_Error if $tag is empty, null if it does not exist.

WP: Retrieves all post tags.
$args Arguments to retrieve tags. See get_terms() for additional options. 'taxonomy'(string) Taxonomy to retrieve terms for. Default 'post_tag'.
Returns: (WP_Term[]|int|WP_Error) Array of 'post_tag' term objects, a count thereof, or WP_Error if any of the taxonomies do not exist.

WP: Get comma-separated list of tags available to edit.
$post_id
$taxonomy The taxonomy for which to retrieve terms.
Returns: (string|false|WP_Error)

WP: Retrieves the permalink for a tag feed.
$tag_id Tag ID.
$feed Feed type. Possible values include 'rss2', 'atom'. Default is the value of get_default_feed().
Returns: (string) The feed permalink for the given tag.

WP: Retrieves the link to the tag.
$tag Tag ID or object.
Returns: (string) Link on success, empty string if tag does not exist.

WP: Return RegEx body to liberally match an opening HTML tag.
$tag An HTML tag name. Example: 'video'.
Returns: (string) Tag RegEx.

WP: Retrieve path of tag template in current or parent template.
Returns: (string) Full path to tag template file.

WP: Retrieves a list of registered taxonomy names or objects.
$args An array of key => value arguments to match against the taxonomy objects.
$output The type of output to return in the array. Accepts either taxonomy 'names' or 'objects'.
$operator The logical operation to perform. Accepts 'and' or 'or'. 'or' means only one element from the array needs to match; 'and' means all elements must match.
Returns: (string[]|WP_Taxonomy[]) An array of taxonomy names or objects.

WP: Retrieves all of the taxonomies that are registered for attachments.
$output The type of taxonomy output to return. Accepts 'names' or 'objects'.
Returns: (string[]|WP_Taxonomy[]) Array of names or objects of registered taxonomies for attachments.

WP: Retrieves the taxonomy object of $taxonomy.
$taxonomy Name of taxonomy object to return.
Returns: (WP_Taxonomy|false) The Taxonomy Object or false if $taxonomy doesn't exist.

WP: Builds an object with all taxonomy labels out of a taxonomy object.
$tax Taxonomy object.
Returns: (object) Taxonomy labels object. The first default value is for non-hierarchical taxonomies (like tags) and the second one is for hierarchical taxonomies (like categories).

WP: Retrieve path of custom taxonomy term template in current or parent template.
Returns: (string) Full path to custom taxonomy term template file.

WP: Given a taxonomy query, generates SQL to be appended to a main query.
$tax_query A compact tax query
$primary_table
$primary_id_column
Returns: (array)

WP: Retrieves name of the current theme.
Returns: (string) Template name.

WP: Retrieves template directory path for current theme.
Returns: (string) Path to current theme's template directory.

WP: Retrieves template directory URI for current theme.
Returns: (string) URI to current theme's template directory.

WP: Loads a template part into a template.
$slug The slug name for the generic template.
$name The name of the specialised template.
$args Additional arguments passed to the template.
Returns: (void|false) Void on success, false if the template does not exist.

WP: Determine a writable directory for temporary files.
Returns: (string) Writable temporary directory.

WP: Get all Term data from database by Term ID.
$term If integer, term data will be fetched from the database, or from the cache if available. If stdClass object (as in the results of a database query), will apply filters and return a WP_Term object with the $term data. If WP_Term, will return $term.
$taxonomy Taxonomy name that $term is part of.
$output The required return type. One of OBJECT, ARRAY_A, or ARRAY_N, which correspond to a WP_Term object, an associative array, or a numeric array, respectively.
$filter How to sanitize term fields.
Returns: (WP_Term|array|WP_Error|null) WP_Term instance (or array) on success, depending on the $output value. WP_Error if $taxonomy does not exist. Null for miscellaneous failure.

WP: Retrieves the terms in a given taxonomy or list of taxonomies.
$args Array or string of arguments. See WP_Term_Query::__construct() for information on accepted arguments.
$deprecated Argument array, when using the legacy function parameter format. If present, this parameter will be interpreted as $args, and the first function parameter will be parsed as a taxonomy or array of taxonomies.
Returns: (WP_Term[]|int[]|string[]|string|WP_Error) Array of terms, a count thereof as a numeric string, or WP_Error if any of the taxonomies do not exist. See the function description for more information.

WP: Get comma-separated list of terms available to edit for the given post ID.
$post_id
$taxonomy The taxonomy for which to retrieve terms.
Returns: (string|false|WP_Error)

WP: Get all Term data from database by Term field and data.
$field Either 'slug', 'name', 'id' or 'ID' (term_id), or 'term_taxonomy_id'.
$value Search for this term value.
$taxonomy Taxonomy name. Optional, if $field is 'term_taxonomy_id'.
$output The required return type. One of OBJECT, ARRAY_A, or ARRAY_N, which correspond to a WP_Term object, an associative array, or a numeric array, respectively.
$filter How to sanitize term fields.
Returns: (WP_Term|array|false) WP_Term instance (or array) on success, depending on the $output value. False if $taxonomy does not exist or $term was not found.

WP: Merge all term children into a single array of their IDs.
$term_id ID of Term to get children.
$taxonomy Taxonomy Name.
Returns: (array|WP_Error) List of Term IDs. WP_Error returned if $taxonomy does not exist.

WP: Retrieves the feed link for a term.
$term_id Term ID.
$taxonomy Taxonomy of $term_id.
$feed Feed type. Possible values include 'rss2', 'atom'. Default is the value of get_default_feed().
Returns: (string|false) Link to the feed for the term specified by $term_id and $taxonomy.

WP: Get sanitized Term field.
$field Term field to fetch.
$term Term ID or object.
$taxonomy Taxonomy Name.
$context How to sanitize term fields. Look at sanitize_term_field() for available options.
Returns: (string|int|null|WP_Error) Will return an empty string if $term is not an object or if $field is not set in $term.

WP: Generate a permalink for a taxonomy term archive.
$term The term object, ID, or slug whose link will be retrieved.
$taxonomy Taxonomy.
Returns: (string|WP_Error) URL of the taxonomy term archive on success, WP_Error if term does not exist.

WP: Retrieves metadata for a term.
$term_id Term ID.
$key The meta key to retrieve. By default, returns data for all keys.
$single Whether to return a single value. This parameter has no effect if $key is not specified.
Returns: (mixed) An array of values if $single is false. The value of the meta field if $single is true. False for an invalid $term_id (non-numeric, zero, or negative value). An empty string if a valid but non-existing term ID is passed.

WP: Retrieves term parents with separator.
$term_id Term ID.
$taxonomy Taxonomy name.
$args Array of optional arguments. 'format'(string) Use term names or slugs for display. Accepts 'name' or 'slug'. Default 'name'. 'separator'(string) Separator for between the terms. Default '/'. 'link'(bool) Whether to format as a link. Default true. 'inclusive'(bool) Include the term to get the parents for. Default true.
Returns: (string|WP_Error) A list of term parents on success, WP_Error or empty string on failure.

WP: Sanitizes Term for editing.
$id Term ID or object.
$taxonomy Taxonomy name.
Returns: (string|int|null|WP_Error) Will return empty string if $term is not an object.

WP: Retrieve theme data.
$theme Theme name.
Returns: (array|null) Null, if theme name does not exist. Theme data, if exists.

WP: Retrieve list of themes with theme data in theme directory.
Returns: (array) Theme list with theme data.

WP: Retrieve theme data from parsed theme file.
$theme_file Theme file path.
Returns: (array) Theme data.

WP: Retrieve list of WordPress theme features (aka theme tags).
$api Whether try to fetch tags from the WordPress.org API. Defaults to true.
Returns: (array) Array of features keyed by category with translations keyed by slug.

WP: Retrieves the path of a file in the theme.
$file File to search for in the stylesheet directory.
Returns: (string) The path of the file.

WP: Retrieves the URL of a file in the theme.
$file File to search for in the stylesheet directory.
Returns: (string) The URL of the file.

WP: Retrieves theme modification value for the current theme.
$name Theme modification name.
$default Theme modification default value.
Returns: (mixed) Theme modification value.

WP: Retrieves all theme modifications.
Returns: (array|void) Theme modifications.

WP: Retrieves path to themes directory.
$stylesheet_or_template The stylesheet or template name of the theme. Default is to leverage the main theme root.
Returns: (string) Themes directory path.

WP: Retrieves theme roots.
Returns: (array|string) An array of theme roots keyed by template/stylesheet or a single theme root if all themes have the same root.

WP: Retrieves URI for themes directory.
$stylesheet_or_template The stylesheet or template name of the theme. Default is to leverage the main theme root.
$theme_root The theme root for which calculations will be based, preventing the need for a get_raw_theme_root() call.
Returns: (string) Themes directory URI.

WP: Expands a theme’s starter content configuration using core-provided data.
Returns: (array) Array of starter content.

WP: Gets the theme support arguments passed when registering that support.
$feature The feature to check. See add_theme_support() for the list of possible values.
$args extra arguments to be checked against certain features.
Returns: (mixed) The array of extra arguments or the value for the registered feature.

WP: Retrieve the update link if there is a theme update available.
$theme WP_Theme object.
Returns: (string|false) HTML for the update link, or false if invalid info was passed.

WP: Retrieves the description for an author, post type, or term archive.
Returns: (string) Archive description.

WP: Retrieve the archive title based on the queried object.
Returns: (string) Archive title.

WP: Retrieve HTML content of attachment image with link.
$id Post ID.
$fullsize Whether to use full size image.
$max_dims Max image dimensions.
$permalink Whether to include permalink to image.
Returns: (string)

WP: Retrieve the author of the current post.
$deprecated Deprecated.
Returns: (string|null) The author's display name.

WP: Retrieve the AIM address of the author of the current post.
Returns: (string) The author's AIM address.

WP: Retrieve the description of the author of the current post.
Returns: (string) The author's description.

WP: Retrieve the email of the author of the current post.
Returns: (string) The author's username.

WP: Retrieve the first name of the author of the current post.
Returns: (string) The author's first name.

WP: Retrieve the ICQ number of the author of the current post.
Returns: (string) The author's ICQ number.

WP: Retrieve the ID of the author of the current post.
Returns: (string|int) The author's ID.

WP: Retrieve the last name of the author of the current post.
Returns: (string) The author's last name.

WP: Retrieve either author’s link or author’s name.
Returns: (string|null) An HTML link if the author's url exist in user meta, else the result of get_the_author().

WP: Retrieve the login name of the author of the current post.
Returns: (string) The author's login name (username).

WP: Retrieves the requested data of the author of the current post.
$field The user field to retrieve.
$user_id User ID.
Returns: (string) The author's field from the current author's DB object, otherwise an empty string.

WP: Retrieve the MSN address of the author of the current post.
Returns: (string) The author's MSN address.

WP: Retrieve the nickname of the author of the current post.
Returns: (string) The author's nickname.

WP: Retrieve the number of posts by the author of the current post.
Returns: (int) The number of posts by the author.

WP: Retrieves an HTML link to the author page of the current post’s author.
Returns: (string) An HTML link to the author page, or an empty string if $authordata isn't defined.

WP: Retrieve the URL to the home page of the author of the current post.
Returns: (string) The URL to the author's page.

WP: Retrieve the Yahoo! IM name of the author of the current post.
Returns: (string) The author's Yahoo! IM name.

WP: Returns the markup for the current template.
Returns: (string) Block template markup.

WP: Retrieves post categories.
$post_id The post ID. Defaults to current post ID.
Returns: (WP_Term[]) Array of WP_Term objects, one for each category assigned to the post.

WP: Retrieves category name based on category ID.
$cat_ID Category ID.
Returns: (string|WP_Error) Category name on success, WP_Error on failure.

WP: Retrieves category list for a post in either HTML list or custom format.
$separator Separator between the categories. By default, the links are placed in an unordered list. An empty string will result in the default behavior.
$parents How to display the parents.
$post_id Post ID to retrieve categories.
Returns: (string) Category list for a post.

WP: Retrieve all of the post categories, formatted for use in feeds.
$type default is the type returned by get_default_feed().
Returns: (string) All of the post categories for displaying in the feed.

WP: Retrieves navigation to next/previous set of comments, when applicable.
$args Default comments navigation arguments. 'prev_text'(string) Anchor text to display in the previous comments link. Default 'Older comments'. 'next_text'(string) Anchor text to display in the next comments link. Default 'Newer comments'. 'screen_reader_text'(string) Screen reader text for the nav element. Default 'Comments navigation'. 'aria_label'(string) ARIA label text for the nav element. Default 'Comments'. 'class'(string) Custom class for the nav element. Default 'comment-navigation'.
Returns: (string) Markup for comments links.

WP: Retrieves a paginated navigation to next/previous set of comments, when applicable.
$args Default pagination arguments. 'screen_reader_text'(string) Screen reader text for the nav element. Default 'Comments navigation'. 'aria_label'(string) ARIA label text for the nav element. Default 'Comments'. 'class'(string) Custom class for the nav element. Default 'comments-pagination'.
Returns: (string) Markup for pagination links.

WP: Retrieve the post content.
$more_link_text Content for when there is more text.
$strip_teaser Strip teaser content before the more text.
$post WP_Post instance or Post ID/object.
Returns: (string)

WP: Retrieve the post content for feeds.
$feed_type The type of feed. rss2 | atom | rss | rdf
Returns: (string) The filtered content.

WP: Retrieve the date on which the post was written.
$format PHP date format. Defaults to the 'date_format' option.
$post Post ID or WP_Post object. Default current post.
Returns: (string|false) Date the current post was written. False on failure.

WP: Retrieves the post excerpt.
$post Post ID or WP_Post object. Default is global $post.
Returns: (string) Post excerpt.

WP: Creates the generator XML or Comment for RSS, ATOM, etc.
$type The type of generator to return (html|xhtml|atom|rss2|rdf|comment|export).
Returns: (string|void) The HTML content for the generator.

WP: Retrieve the Post Global Unique Identifier (guid).
$post Post ID or post object. Default is global $post.
Returns: (string)

WP: Retrieve the ID of the current item in the WordPress Loop.
Returns: (int|false) The ID of the current item in the WordPress Loop. False if $post is not set.

WP: Retrieve the author who last edited the current post.
Returns: (string|void) The author's display name.

WP: Retrieve the date on which the post was last modified.
$format PHP date format. Defaults to the 'date_format' option.
$post Post ID or WP_Post object. Default current post.
Returns: (string|int|false) Date the current post was modified. False on failure.

WP: Retrieve the time at which the post was last modified.
$format Format to use for retrieving the time the post was modified. Accepts 'G', 'U', or PHP date format. Defaults to the 'time_format' option.
$post Post ID or WP_Post object. Default current post.
Returns: (string|int|false) Formatted date string or Unix timestamp. False on failure.

WP: Retrieve protected post password form content.
$post Post ID or WP_Post object. Default is global $post.
Returns: (string) HTML content for password form for password protected post.

WP: Retrieves the full permalink for the current post or post ID.
$post Post ID or post object. Default is the global $post.
$leavename Whether to keep post name or page name.
Returns: (string|false) The permalink URL or false if post does not exist.

WP: Returns the navigation to next/previous set of posts, when applicable.
$args Default posts navigation arguments. 'prev_text'(string) Anchor text to display in the previous posts link. Default 'Older posts'. 'next_text'(string) Anchor text to display in the next posts link. Default 'Newer posts'. 'screen_reader_text'(string) Screen reader text for the nav element. Default 'Posts navigation'. 'aria_label'(string) ARIA label text for the nav element. Default 'Posts'. 'class'(string) Custom class for the nav element. Default 'posts-navigation'.
Returns: (string) Markup for posts links.

WP: Retrieves a paginated navigation to next/previous set of posts, when applicable.
$args Default pagination arguments, see paginate_links(). 'screen_reader_text'(string) Screen reader text for navigation element. Default 'Posts navigation'. 'aria_label'(string) ARIA label text for the nav element. Default 'Posts'. 'class'(string) Custom class for the nav element. Default 'pagination'.
Returns: (string) Markup for pagination links.

WP: Retrieves the navigation to next/previous post, when applicable.
$args Default post navigation arguments. 'prev_text'(string) Anchor text to display in the previous post link. Default '%title'. 'next_text'(string) Anchor text to display in the next post link. Default '%title'. 'in_same_term'(bool) Whether link should be in a same taxonomy term. Default false. 'excluded_terms'(int[]|string) Array or comma-separated list of excluded term IDs. 'taxonomy'(string) Taxonomy, if $in_same_term is true. Default 'category'. 'screen_reader_text'(string) Screen reader text for the nav element. Default 'Post navigation'. 'aria_label'(string) ARIA label text for the nav element. Default 'Posts'. 'class'(string) Custom class for the nav element. Default 'post-navigation'.
Returns: (string) Markup for post links.

WP: Retrieve the post thumbnail.
$post Post ID or WP_Post object. Default is global $post.
$size Image size. Accepts any registered image size name, or an array of width and height values in pixels (in that order).
$attr Query string or array of attributes.
Returns: (string) The post thumbnail image tag.

WP: Returns the post thumbnail caption.
$post Post ID or WP_Post object. Default is global $post.
Returns: (string) Post thumbnail caption.

WP: Return the post thumbnail URL.
$post Post ID or WP_Post object. Default is global $post.
$size Registered image size to retrieve the source for or a flat array of height and width dimensions.
Returns: (string|false) Post thumbnail URL or false if no image is available. If $size does not match any registered image size, the original image URL will be returned.

WP: Retrieves the description for a post type archive.
Returns: (string) The post type description.

WP: Returns the privacy policy link with formatting, when applicable.
$before Display before privacy policy link.
$after Display after privacy policy link.
Returns: (string) Markup for the link and surrounding elements. Empty string if it doesn't exist.

WP: Retrieves the tags for a post.
$post_id Post ID or object.
Returns: (WP_Term[]|false|WP_Error) Array of WP_Term objects on success, false if there are no terms or the post does not exist, WP_Error on failure.

WP: Retrieves the tags for a post formatted as a string.
$before String to use before the tags.
$sep String to use between the tags.
$after String to use after the tags.
$post_id Post ID. Defaults to the current post ID.
Returns: (string|false|WP_Error) A list of tags on success, false if there are no terms, WP_Error on failure.

WP: Retrieve all taxonomies associated with a post.
$post Post ID or WP_Post object. Default is global $post.
$args Arguments about how to format the list of taxonomies. 'template'(string) Template for displaying a taxonomy label and list of terms. Default is "Label: Terms." 'term_template'(string) Template for displaying a single term in the list. Default is the term name linked to its archive.
Returns: (array) List of taxonomies.

WP: Retrieves the terms of the taxonomy that are attached to the post.
$post Post ID or object.
$taxonomy Taxonomy name.
Returns: (WP_Term[]|false|WP_Error) Array of WP_Term objects on success, false if there are no terms or the post does not exist, WP_Error on failure.

WP: Retrieves a post’s terms as a list with specified format.
$post_id Post ID.
$taxonomy Taxonomy name.
$before String to use before the terms.
$sep String to use between the terms.
$after String to use after the terms.
Returns: (string|false|WP_Error) A list of terms on success, false if there are no terms, WP_Error on failure.

WP: Retrieve the time at which the post was written.

$args Array or string of arguments for generating paginated links for archives. 'base'(string) Base of the paginated url. 'format'(string) Format for the pagination structure. 'total'(int) The total amount of pages. Default is the value WP_Query's max_num_pages or 1. 'current'(int) The current page number. Default is 'paged' query var or 1. 'aria_current'(string) The value for the aria-current attribute. Possible values are 'page', 'step', 'location', 'date', 'time', 'true', 'false'. Default is 'page'. 'show_all'(bool) Whether to show all pages. Default false. 'end_size'(int) How many numbers on either the start and the end list edges. Default 1. 'mid_size'(int) How many numbers to either side of the current pages. Default 2. 'prev_next'(bool) Whether to include the previous and next links in the list. Default true. 'prev_text'(bool) The previous page text. Default '« Previous'. 'next_text'(bool) The next page text. Default 'Next »'. 'type'(string) Controls format of the returned value. Possible values are 'plain', 'array' and 'list'. Default is 'plain'. 'add_args'(array) An array of query args to add. Default false. 'add_fragment'(string) A string to append to each link. 'before_page_number'(string) A string to appear before the page number. 'after_page_number'(string) A string to append after the page number.
Returns: (string|array|void) String of page links or array of page links, depending on 'type' argument. Void if total number of pages is less than 2.

WP: Retrieves plugin installer pages from the WordPress.org Plugins API.
$action API action to perform: 'query_plugins', 'plugin_information', 'hot_tags' or 'hot_categories'.
$args Array or object of arguments to serialize for the Plugin Info API. 'slug'(string) The plugin slug. 'per_page'(int) Number of plugins per page. Default 24. 'page'(int) Number of current page. Default 1. 'number'(int) Number of tags or categories to be queried. 'search'(string) A search term. 'tag'(string) Tag to filter plugins. 'author'(string) Username of an plugin author to filter plugins. 'user'(string) Username to query for their favorites. 'browse'(string) Browse view: 'popular', 'new', 'beta', 'recommended'. 'locale'(string) Locale to provide context-sensitive results. Default is the value of get_locale(). 'installed_plugins'(string) Installed plugins to provide context-sensitive results. 'is_ssl'(bool) Whether links should be returned with https or not. Default false. 'fields'(array) Array of fields which should or should not be returned. 'short_description'(bool) Whether to return the plugin short description. Default true. 'description'(bool) Whether to return the plugin full description. Default false. 'sections'(bool) Whether to return the plugin readme sections: description, installation, FAQ, screenshots, other notes, and changelog. Default false. 'tested'(bool) Whether to return the 'Compatible up to' value. Default true. 'requires'(bool) Whether to return the required WordPress version. Default true. 'requires_php'(bool) Whether to return the required PHP version. Default true. 'rating'(bool) Whether to return the rating in percent and total number of ratings. Default true. 'ratings'(bool) Whether to return the number of rating for each star (1-5). Default true. 'downloaded'(bool) Whether to return the download count. Default true. 'downloadlink'(bool) Whether to return the download link for the package. Default true. 'last_updated'(bool) Whether to return the date of the last update. Default true. 'added'(bool) Whether to return the date when the plugin was added to the wordpress.org repository. Default true. 'tags'(bool) Whether to return the assigned tags. Default true. 'compatibility'(bool) Whether to return the WordPress compatibility list. Default true. 'homepage'(bool) Whether to return the plugin homepage link. Default true. 'versions'(bool) Whether to return the list of all available versions. Default false. 'donate_link'(bool) Whether to return the donation link. Default true. 'reviews'(bool) Whether to return the plugin reviews. Default false. 'banners'(bool) Whether to return the banner images links. Default false. 'icons'(bool) Whether to return the icon links. Default false. 'active_installs'(bool) Whether to return the number of active installations. Default false. 'group'(bool) Whether to return the assigned group. Default false. 'contributors'(bool) Whether to return the list of contributors. Default false.
Returns: (object|array|WP_Error) Response object or array on success, WP_Error on failure. See the function reference article for more information on the make-up of possible return values depending on the value of $action.

WP: Registers a meta key.
$object_type Type of object metadata is for. Accepts 'post', 'comment', 'term', 'user', or any other object type with an associated meta table.
$meta_key Meta key to register.
$args Data used to describe the meta key when registered. 'object_subtype'(string) A subtype; e.g. if the object type is "post", the post type. If left empty, the meta key will be registered on the entire object type. Default empty. 'type'(string) The type of data associated with this meta key. Valid values are 'string', 'boolean', 'integer', 'number', 'array', and 'object'. 'description'(string) A description of the data attached to this meta key. 'single'(bool) Whether the meta key has one value per object, or an array of values per object. 'default'(mixed) The default value returned from get_metadata() if no value has been set yet. When using a non-single meta key, the default value is for the first entry. In other words, when calling get_metadata() with $single set to false, the default value given here will be wrapped in an array. 'sanitize_callback'(callable) A function or method to call when sanitizing $meta_key data. 'auth_callback'(callable) Optional. A function or method to call when performing edit_post_meta, add_post_meta, and delete_post_meta capability checks. 'show_in_rest'(bool|array) Whether data associated with this meta key can be considered public and should be accessible via the REST API. A custom post type must also declare support for custom fields for registered meta to be accessible via REST. When registering complex meta values this argument may optionally be an array with 'schema' or 'prepare_callback' keys instead of a boolean.
$deprecated Deprecated. Use $args instead.
Returns: (bool) True if the meta key was successfully registered in the global array, false if not. Registering a meta key with distinct sanitize and auth callbacks will fire those callbacks, but will not add to the global registry.
